title: Excellent place to stay in NYC
text: My favorite place to stay in NYC. The hotel is super charming, the rooms a little small but very comfortable. The restaurant and bar amazing (recommend the truffle mac&cheese, my kids favorite there since they were little). Amazing food at breakfast as well. The concierge always helpful. I’ve already stayed at soho grand over 5 times in my life and it’s still my first choice while visiting NYC. Great location as well.

title: Good vibes and service
text: Amazing server named Siri he was very attentive and had a great personality. He filled all our needs. As for the the restaurant the prices were good and the environment was beautiful. Would come again. Amazing vibe with friends again would recommend

title: Soho at its best.
text: The staff at the SoHo Grand are all top notch….but one stands out the above the rest….Lerdy. She went above and beyond when there were little bumps in the road. Hotel is in great location. It also has a great lounge on the second floor. DJ during the week so it has a cool vibe.

title: Favorite  Place to stay in NYC!
text: We had the best time at the Soho Grand!  Every step of the way was seamless, from pre- arrival planning to wonderful corner rooms with great views! Everything has been spectacular!  Thank you Soho Grand especially Kalwson and Naomi for making this an unforgettable trip!

title: Soho Grand was grandish
text:
Stayed here recently on an added night to my NYC trip. I was staying at the ACE in their biggest suite and came here from a recommendation from a friend. The hotel was well kept, lots of smell of marijuana out side (real potpourri)  but better then the pee every where else in NYC. The valet gentlemen greeted me and showed me where to go, went to the front desk where I was greeted by Klewson? I think that was his name, was a little different and was kind, First he offered me water, asked me a cpl questions and then offered me my room. He was very polite and knowledgeable of the area when I pressed him for recommendations. 

The room itself was comfortable, but a little smaller (but my other room was 1,500 square feet so of course found it small. Had a nice view of downtown NY. 

At night upon my return from errands I ended up cruising by the bar, the bar was packed, celebrities and beautiful people. it was quite the vibe there. Probably best bar I frequented on my entire trip. 

Next time I visit NYC I will plan to stay there.

title: Thank you for all your help!
text: I book at Soho Grand very frequently and I am constantly impressed with the responsiveness of the reservation staff as I experience a lot of changes in my reservations. They are always on top of it, and it makes my life so much easier knowing I can count on them for help when needed. Thank you so much!!

Great service and friendly staff. When we asked for extra hangers, they brought a whole extra hanging rack which was fantastic
Very easy to walk to SoHo restaurants, tribecca, Chinatown and LES. Great subway access. Fun evenings in the bar and lounge. 
Highly recommend

title: A Great Hotel!
text:
Background: I recently retired after 41 years as a firefighter and paramedic. My wife and I saved up to celebrate my retirement by visiting NYC, which is actually my original hometown. After much research into which hotel we would stay at, we decided on the Soho Grand Hotel, based on the many positive online reviews and close proximity to several of the neighborhoods that we enjoy.

Upon our arrival, we were greeted by hotel doormen Danny and Jose, who welcomed us and took care of our luggage. These same two gentlemen would continue to look after us during our stay, by offering us a smile and warm greetings as well restaurant recommendations (check out Soho pizza on the corner) and local directions.

After checking-in at registration and receiving our room keys, we made it up to our room, which was located in the 11th floor and afforded us some views of the world below. Our luggage soon arrived as well as a welcome gift of a bottle of wine from Manager Marcus Morales. Thank you Marcus! The room itself was spacious and nicely appointed. The bathroom too was really nice  and very roomy. The room’s
lighting controls were a bit “quirky”, but we eventually got the hang of it. The shower controls were a bit “touchy” and it was somewhat challenging to adjust the water temperature at times.  All in all, one of the nicer hotel rooms that I’ve stayed in. Also, the hotel elevators were extremely fast and almost always available.

Our trip was budgeted for 10 nights and that was a stretch for us, as the hotel is a bit pricey for
us. Unfortunately both my wife and I contracted COVID while in NYC, requiring a self-imposed 5 day quarantine as well as needing to add 3 additional nights to our stay, until we were well enough to travel back home to California.

We notified the hotel staff of our illness, as we did not want to expose housekeeping or other hotel staff (or anyone else) to possibly getting sick.

While we were on “lockdown”, the front desk manager called and checked on us daily, to see if we had any needs. She offered us tea and fresh towels/sheets from housekeeping, since we could neither leave our room or let housekeeping in. This was very kind of her and much appreciated. Speaking of Housekeeping, we met a very sweet woman named Muriel, who also checked in on us frequently and offered to meet any needs that we might have. Muriel is a keeper, for sure.

All in all, we had a great time at the Soho Grand Hotel. Even though we were only able to explore NYC for about 5 full days out of our 13 day trip, we made the best of it. The staff at this hotel turned a crappy situation into a tolerable situation and we were grateful for this.

If we can afford to, my wife and I hope to return to NYC sometime in the next few months, to see and experience some things that we missed during this trip. Although we may have found our new “home away from home” at the Soho Grand Hotel, we may have to stay elsewhere next time, as our finances took a bit of an unexpected hit this time and we look for something a little bit more inexpensive. That being said, the rates at Soho Grand Hotel are quite attractive in January/February, so maybe again next year or the year after?

I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a hip, stylish yet very
friendly place to stay. The neighborhood is also great and very walkable.

over we loved our stay and the service, the drinks were good and the breakfast was delicious, but also don't forget to tip well when people are being nice and helpful.

text:
Great location, nice rooms but which could use a little refreshment - pillows are way too fluffy!!  The staff is incredible. From the doormen 👍👍 to the housekeepers, everyone is so nice. We went through being sick during this stay, and everyone at the hotel was so nice and helpful. 
The only negative comment is regarding the room service menu. I bit too expensive and a lack of choice for in-room dining.

title: Grand stay
text: Grand stay this December at the Soho Grand! Was my first time staying at the hotel on a friend's recommendation, and was impressed with the friendly, above-and-beyond service (from the front door, to reception, to the diner, to the lobby lounge - special shout out to Leidy, Remington, and James). Booked a corner King room which had plenty of room overlooking the street, and loved the overall hotel vibe. Great neighborhood to duck into a million cool spots to eat, drink, and of course take advantage of all the shopping. Easy walk from Soho to east and west village etc. Will definitely be back!

title: Great Stay
text: This hotel is gorgeous, classy and upscale! It's close to the Village area so very convenient. I want to shout out the front desk staff, Barrington- for having such a great smile and being so helpful at check in! I would definitely stay here again.

title: Terrible stay
text:
Extremly dirty room, the floor hasn’t been cleaned for months! I accidentally dropped a pen under the bed, yikes! We also found old food in the cabinet. We stayed for a week and paid USD 1000 a night, you will find a far better hotel for that kind of money! 

The staff is unpolite and plain rude! 

You should also know that the hotel has a night club and when you return to the hotel in the evening it is really difficult to pass by the (drunk) crowd. 

Try Mercer instead, it is fabulous!

title: Soho Grand is THE PLACE to stay in NYC
text:
I have stayed at The Soho Grand 3 times in the past year and each time has been a wonderful experience! Great location and a great customer experience! 
The Soho Grand team is all so kind and helpful and phenomenal- they always take care of us and make sure we have everything we need to have the best stay!

title: Xmas time in NY
text:
Amazing stay.
Perfectly located and very well maintained.
Perfect for shopping and dining around! 
My room on the 14th floor had a beautiful view.
I was impressed by the cleaning service, impeccable.
I must thank Mark during the reservation time and Charles and Claudia for the warm welcome. Highly recommended!

title: Never Fails to Please
text:
Love the location and property.  Travel so much, we spend 10-12 days a month in hotels, so we LOVE when the properties partner with AMEX and keep a log of our history with them.  We arrived late Thursday and were greeted wonderfully with a room upgrade (AMEX perk) to a corner room- a note had been placed that i like extra pillows and towels so those items had been placed and water for Will and Prosecco for me lol.  Smallish room but, as always, handsomely appointed with a lovely view up w Broadway.  Had daily full American breakfast (Amex perk) and enjoyed a $100 property credit in the lounge for an afternoon snack (get the ricotta and pita!)

The lounge has the music WAY too loud at 715 (met friends for a pre dinner drink Friday night and couldnt hear them).

Alexis, at reception, a stand out and AMAZING team member.

title: Best hotel in the city
text: Soho Grand exceeded every expectation I had. It has a true boutique feel to it, incorporating elements of the surrounding neighborhood into its design and ambiance. The staff is also wonderful - from the doorman that greeted me upon my arrival to the bartender in the Grand Bar (which has an incredible bourbon selection by the way). You can tell the room is thoughtfully prepared for your arrival, creating a cozy and comfortable home base for you during your stay in the Big Apple. My favorite part of the hotel is the vibrant energy that permeates through the building. From a classic dinner experience to a lively bar and club room, the hotel truly emulates the energy of the incredible city New York is. Could not recommend staying here more.

title: Nice weekend!
text: Enjoyed great weekend stay at hotel. It is pricey, but surely if fantastic. Service and staff 5 Star!. great location, Nice upscale diner attatched. Nice place. Wish it was a bit more affordable. I will go back for special occasions....

title: Beauty, Grace, and impeccable service.
text: It’s what you would expect from a hotel. The atmosphere is sophisticated with a 1940s decor feel. The staff is extremely cordial and accommodating. The rooms are quiet and comfortable. The dining and room service are impeccable. I would gladly stay here again and again. No gripes here. Not.  One.

title: Great location
text: Great location which enabled us to walk everywhere we wanted to go. Hotel was very dark, needed more lights. Room size was good. We informed reception we were leaving early in the morning and was told the desk and lobby were always manned. No one was there when we left and luckily we ordered our own Uber as no one was there to get us a cab/help with luggage

title: Wonderful experience!
text: From the moment I arrived for a week long stay, I felt better taken care of than at any other hotel I've previously stayed.  Everyone is so kind and attentive. Andrew at the front desk made sure I had a room that would be quiet. On a very busy night, Chris, the manager at the Club Room helped me with last minute reservations and seated me at a table where I could watch the show. The rooms are immaculate, spacious and the bed is so comfortable. The room service was fast and the food was delicious. I loved the automatic sun shades and the bluetooth radio was fantastic. My entire visit was wonderful. I can't wait to be back!

title: Can’t SLEEP HERE!
text: LOUD THUMPING Music PLAYS UNTIL 2am (hopefully) -  we called downstairs at 1 am and were told it was the restaurant and should go off on an hour!! Looks like a nice place but don’t bother to surge the night, maybe just visit the lobby bar for overpriced drinks … MAYBE

title: Loyal Soho Grand guests for 25 years
text: Wonderful family trip, including our dogs! We always stay at the Soho Grand and the service and experience are always perfect. It’s a luxury hotel but the staff are friendly and down to earth. Everyone is super helpful. And best coffee in town at Soho Diner.

title: Top notch hotel driven by great service
text: First, Thanks to Claudia at the front desk, a welcoming smile in a bustling city. Because we were Capital One members we got a free upgrade and $50 credit. So that was cool. The room was large for NYC, and the bed super comfortable. A ridiculously large TV that I could link to my phone for the remote (but I couldn’t for the life of me figure out how to get my Netflix). Interesting drinks at the bar, and a good diner in the ground floor (pricey…but it’s NY). So many interesting architectural touches, too. I still can’t figure out whether it’s old and redone, or whether it’s new. It was that flawless

title: Exceptional Customer Service
text:
Definitely not inexpensive but worth every penny.  Dave Chapelle stayed there while I was there which gives you an idea of the quality of the hotel.  The staff are very conscientious of all their guests, from nobodies like myself to celebrities like Mr. Chapelle (no one there told us he was there).  The service sets them apart.  Just one example, we told the young woman checking us in about a special event occurring while we were there and she remembered and sent up champagne and chocolates on the day of.  Gratis.  

There is a top-shelf restaurant located in the hotel and a 24 hr, attached diner both of which provide room service.  

And, right around the corner from the hotel is a 99 cent pizza place which is shockingly good in case you have a hankering for pepperoni at 3am.

title: Perfect Stay at the SoHo Grand
text:
The Soho Grand is the only property I want to stay in from now on when visiting NYC. Marcus, the property’s Guest Experience Manager made sure I well taken care of before I even arrived. A++ experience, perfect Soho location, staff goes above and beyond to support any request, from printing, shipping etc. I was staying for business and really just used my room to work and crash, but work or leisure, I’ll definitely be back!

X

title: Great location, staff and ambiance.
text: The location is truly the best. Neat shopping and restaurants. We rarely needed to use public transportation. The staff is helpful and friendly and the rooms are spacious. The ambiance is very cool as well. All around great stay. We will be back.

title: Soho Grand
text: I stay regularly at the Soho Grand.  The team there is always kind and friendly. Service is always top notch. Marcus Morales, remembers me and always stops to say hello and offers amazing guest service.  I’ve stayed all over the city and I will keep coming back to the Soho Grand.

title: Chill and luxe
text: Great hotel experience in soho, chill vibe, friendly staff, excellent food & beverage, spotless rooms with luxe amenities.   Gym is a little small, but they have decent equipment.  Have stayed multiple times and will continue to do so!

title: Scrumptious Breakfast
text: Scrumptious Breakfast served in the guest lounge. Great service. Cool music. Nice vibe. Relaxed. Great place for business meetings. Staff attentive without being too intrusive. Good choice of dishes and hot drinks

title: Best Hotel in The City
text: My stay was amazing as usual and the Manager Marcus goes over and beyond for any of your needs. My favorite place to stay by far in New York. Plus you can’t find a better location. Everything you need

title: Fabulous Experience at SoHo Grand
text: SoHo Grand did not disappoint from the moment we entered the hotel! My husband and I decided to visit NYC for our anniversary, which was a great decision. The hotel staff is superb, the rooms were comfy/cozy, the location was perfect! Once they found out it was our anniversary, a nice bottle of Champagne was sent to our room as well as 2 breakfast tickets to the hotel restaurant. The bar/restaurant was the right vibe, love the music, and the ambiance. I will recommend this hotel x10 as we will return in the near future. Thanks SoHo

title: Ultimate Hospitality
text: Soho grand is our home (& office) away from home. Marcus made this stay extra welcoming;  our corner room had a view so nice we had to extend our staycation.  Breakfasts in the lobby bar are a must.  Our service animal also gives the hotel and dog park five paws🐾🐾🐾🐾🐾

title: Amazing NYC hotel
text: I recently moved out of nyc. This is the only hotel I stay at. The staff is very friendly and attentive. The lobby is nice and quiet during the day like a living room. I frequently sit on one of the couches and read. And at happy hour there is a great crowd. It’s also in one of the best shopping areas in the city. Conveniently located next to all the subways. In my opinion, the Soho Grand is the best hotel in nyc. And I lived there for 16 years.

title: Grand experience
text:
I was on a last minute trip to NYC for business and needed to be in the soho area. While on the plane I didn’t have reception so I called soho grand and they had a room available and I booked it. 

When I checked in I was greeted by a gentleman named Marcus and I have to say the professionalism and courtesy I received was better than most 5 start hotels I’ve stayed at around the world. Great location, great staff.

title: The best experience in SOHO
text:
The staff at SOHO Grand is second to none. I recommend this hotel to everybody, because I've never experienced a "frustrating hotel issue" here.

They remember me when I pull up to the hotel (and it's usually several months between my stays), check-in is always EASY, and the bartenders in the lounge make a mean drink! 10/10!!

title: Everyone is treated like a VIP there - philmore4
text: Marcus was amazing !! We only stay there because of his and the  SGH  team’s hospitality from the door guys smiling while they greet you to the resteraunt team  with Grand  margaritas and comfortable lobby couches to the sexy dog run for our dog  Riley   to even the maintence guys adjusting the wanky cable middle of the night in your suite  lol. It’s all there,  whatever u need,  whenever you need it  !!!

title: Home Away From Home
text: I stay at the Soho Grand often and always enjoy my stay. The hotel staff is very friendly, the rooms and amenities are clean, and there are terrific restaurants and shops nearby. It has become a home away from home for me and the only place I will stay in New York for business and vacation.

title: Musty and dark
text: The Soho Grande is a dark musty hotel. Our check in experience set the tone for another hotel in NY that gets by because it’s New York, poor customer service. The room was not ready at 3:00. It finally became ready an hour later. The check in took 40 minutes!!! Our room has a terrible odor. Would not recommend this hotel.

title: SoHo Grand is our Favorite!
text: SoHo Grand is THE BEST hotel in New York City. The rooms are great (especially the suites); the staff is amazing; and the food and drinks are first rate. The bar is a fun place to relax and the 24-hour diner is amazing. If you want to stay in lower Manhattan, this is the place to be!

title: THIS IS THE PLACE TO STAY!
text: THIS IS THE PLACE TO STAY! The location is amazing, right in the heart of Soho, near subway lines and all of the shopping, and I mean ALL. The lounge is comfortable, have live music and a young feel without the feel of blasting music and screaming a conversation. Marcus, the guest customer experience manager is stellar. Rooms are modern, clean, quiet, sheets, pillows, towels are high quality.

title: Average stay
text: Not the best fit if you're there for business.   Night club/DJ  in the bar is super crowded and  there's no where to sit plus it's really loud (you don't want rooms on the 3rd or 4th floor above the bar).   Shower water spills onto the bathroom floor.   Registration desk is on the second floor, no signs on first floor telling you this.    On the positive side, beds are very comfortable, hotel is in a great location, doorman is very helpful and diner next door is convenient.

title: Great stay at SOHO Grand
text: Hands down our favorite place to stay when we are in NYC.  Cozy, boutique hotel in SOHO. Attentive staff. Great food and drinks.  And, the hotel is dog friendly with their own zen doggy park! Highly recommend.

title: Pleasant stay!
text:
Kevin is great representative of Soho Grand! He was very professional, helpful and pleasant! The hotel sits in the heart of Soho which makes it easy to walk for shopping and dining! 

Very pleasant stay!

title: Great Hotel
text:
Good location / neighbourhood, friendly staff, very nice bar/lounge area, small but functional fitness centre, comfortable room (7th floor was quiet and was able to get a good night of sleep)

Can't fault Soho Grand during this stay, everything was on point.

title: 5 Star stay
text: Where to start? First impression, from the moment we stepped out of the cab we were treated impeccably. I so wish I could remember names, but we had had a long flight from the UK and were a little dazed on arrival. Property is just beautiful, Jose (?) whisked our luggage away, check in was smooth, reception welcoming. Rooms outstanding, with wonderfully comfortable beds. Club room….again fantastic,  service impeccable. We had two vegetarians in our party and the server went off to find us some veggie options from a different menu, brilliant service, and they managed to squeeze us in for drinks on a very busy Friday night. Nothing was too much trouble. Soho Diner,, very enjoyable breakfast, and again impeccable service. Thank you for a very warm welcome on our first trip to NYC. Certainly won’t be our last, and we would return in a heartbeat.

title: Fun, chic, very comfortable, and great location.
text:
Fun, chic, very comfortable, and great location.  
(We love that the company pays for the college education of their staff's children - it's one of the details that contributes to retaining such outstanding staff from the moment you arrive at the door.)

title: Bad staff abd bad service
text:
Shocking service and rude receptionist and concierge 
They pass on the problem to another hotel employee and say ‘ it’s not my problem ‘ 
Overpriced for the service and what it is 
Staff have attitude and no service etiquette
So many other better hotels in soho for the same price to go to

title: A place to come back to
text:
- we spent 7 great days at the Soho Grand …. and would come back
- our friends (staying in different hotels in the Soho area always wanted to met up in ‚our‘ bar; everyone was impressed by the ambience, the staff and interiors
- due to a small defect in our room we were asked to change rooms (no one actually likes that once you‘re installed) and were given an upgrade without asking for it 
- we were thrilled by the professionalism as well as the friendliness, openness of the entire staff; especially reception, room staff and door men

title: Always top notch!
text: If you’re looking for quality across the board, from the friendly, competent staff to the accommodations, food, drinks and amenities, make the Soho Grand your top choice. Marcus and Axel are amazing at customer service and the whole team will take care of you!

title: Dramatic Check-in Experience
text:
Business trip: The company sent the voucher on July, obviously the day I checked-in after an intercontinental trip (september…) the hotel realized there was no credit card for the payment of the 4 nights. So I had to call the travel service, who was able to send a copy of the credit card (it took a while to them to realize it was on the email….).
Then I had to leave my own credit card for the “extra”, for an amount
of 800 HUNDRED DOLLARS (yes, maybe they were concerned I could have played tennis with the mirror in the bathroom?).
My company credit card (which I use everywhere in the world, as well in USA) could not be read by the Soho card reader (this is clearly their problem, as I used it everywhere). Then I had to use my personal one, but it did not work as I had a daily maximum and I could not suddenylchange it.
While I was ready to cry, the girl at the reception told that maybe 400 dollars for the extra were enough.
When you travel in USA, this is the risk, inflexible people who follows rigid silly rules, regardless the fact that my company is frequently booking nights for ita employees in this hotel….

title: Best hotel in Soho, if not NYC!
text: My wife and I were in New York City last week and we stayed once again at the Soho Grand. As usual, the stay was fabulous on all fronts. The hotel staff - from the front desk to the front doormen - are fantastic.  The location, restaurants, bars and hotel aesthetics are simply the best.  Thank you again for a terrific experience.

title: Amazing!
text: This is probably our 10th stay at the Soho Grand.  We come back for two consective weekends in September every year.  The staff is beyond accommodating and friendly, escpercial Marcus the manger, Lonie at the front door and Kevin at the front desk.  Beds are beyond comfortable for a great nights rest.  The hotel is in the best spot in Soho. Convenent to all the best resturants and shopping.  And of course this time of the year close to the San Gennaro feast in Little Italy.

title: a nice new home away from home
text: We had such a great stay at the Soho Grand!  After living in NYC 17 years, we are new to discovering where to stay when we come to town and have definitely found a home at the Soho Grand.  We loved the elegance and adult-ness of the property combined with the hip elements of the Soho Diner, the fun and kitchy mini-bar assortment and the chic guests.  The service was perfect: Housekeeping, in particular, stood out - slipping in without me ever noticing or being disturbed a single time during an 8-night stay, but cleaning everything to a T.  Dolly was a star!  The Front Desk/Reception was also so polished and professional.  Beds super-comfy, towels luxe and fluffy and gym was great, too!  We'll be back.

title: Uno degli più belli hotel dove sono stata nel mondo
text:
Hotel bellissimo, pulitissimo: 
Quando i nostri amici newyorkesi vi chiedevano dove alloggiavamo, spalancavano gli occhi dicendoci che era uno dei posti più cool
Di NYC, ed è così. Molto più di un hotel, un’esperienza così come la città di New York. 
Unica pecca la nostra vista, non era granché, ma colazione eccellente, terrazza bellissima, rifacimento della stanza anche 3 volte al giorno, quotidiani, musica di sottofondo quando rientravamo… io che il mondo l’ho girato non posso che confermare uno degli hotel di atmosfera che più mi è rimasto nel cuore

title: Classic NYC
text: From the doormen to reception to the room itself, everything was top notch.  Was a pleasure to stay at this property with the extra comfortable bed and bedding to the classy shower and products.  Grabbed dinner one night at the diner during a rain storm and was great to be inside, warm and enjoying comfort food.  Definitely will keep this hotel on the top of my list whenever my travels bring me back to New York City.

title: Great stay. Would return and recommend.
text: My husband and I had an excellent stay at SoHo Grand recently with our 2 large dogs. We used SpotHero to secure a parking spot in the garage across the street. Check-in was quick and we appreciated the mimosas and offer of dog beds and bowls. Our room on the 15th floor was spacious by city standards and exceptionally clean and quiet. We stayed for one night; however, if you’re staying longer there’s adequate storage and bathroom counter space. We never heard a sound from the surrounding rooms. Our dogs were allowed to dine with us in both the SohoDiner and Grand Salon. The hotel’s dog park around the corner is a beautifully landscaped spot. You can walk to many good restaurants, cafes, and shops from the hotel. We’d return and recommend. Special thanks to Marcus, the concierge who loved our dogs, and  Michael at the front desk for making our stay great.

title: Phenomenal Staff
text: The staff at the Soho Grand is absolutely incredible. I brought my dog for a weekend away and cannot express how amazing they were with him. They were so kind, welcoming, and fun.  Tiffanie, Jose, John, James, Dani, Naomi, and Anthony were especially wonderful. We are so excited for our next trip back and can’t wait to see these wonderful people again.

title: Disappointment @ Stay
text:
The stay was mediocre at best.  If you fancy returning to your hotel at night and see the entire lobby area turn into a disco with DJ, see people making out on stairwell, and have the entire lower lobby strewn with spilled drinks and empty glasses all around the stairs...then this is your place.  
The hotel per se, is a nice hotel in a great neighborhood.  At no point did we expect that when you come to your day of activities that you can't relax in the lobby area, but rather have to retire to your room.  Disappointment.

title: The Staff really cares!!
text: This was our third trip back to the SoHo Grand Hotel, and once again, the hotel and its staff shone brightly! Gracious Marcus Morales and Alexis Ortiz from Guest Services helped us with our reservation, accommodating Axel, Tiffany, and Danny checked us in at the front desk, providing us with flutes of perfectly chilled prosecco and as many bottles of water that we needed, and efficient bellmen Denzel and Kiiloni always had cabs and directions at the ready for use. Truly, I don't know how they do it, but everyone we interfaced with, from servers in the lobby lounge to housekeeping was kind, attentive, and courteous! For us, staying at the SoHo Grand is like staying with a treasured friend, because like a friend, the hotel genuinely cares that you feel taken care of. And we did! We'll be back very soon!

title: Perfect Stay at the Soho Grand
text:
The rooms are upscale industrial with beautiful finishes and sufficiently roomy.
The staff could not be more accommodating and friendly from the front desk, to housekeeping, and the valet.
The location was perfect.

title: Highly Recommend the Soho Grand Hotel
text: The hotel is in such an amazing location, surrounded by great restaurants. Service was impeccable. Rooms are nice and beds so comfortable. Room service is very prompt and food was delicious. Walking distance to so many things.

title: Shower Broke- Danny was Great!
text: The shower in my room didn’t work but the professionalism and politeness of Danny at the front desk made a big difference. He is truly an asset to the Soho Grand Hotel. I have stayed at the Soho Grand Hotel over the last 10 years without any problems so this was my first but like I said Danny did his best to rectify the issue. Thank You.

title: Fantastic stay
text: What an amazing hotel. Location was central especially for navigating downtown. Very easy to get midtown as well. The hotel and room was very clean and quiet. The room layout and size was very generous. The lighting everywhere seem to be perfect and very rich. This is a perfect hotel for a NYC stay.

title: Very accommodating
text:
Axel at the front desk did an amazing job and went out of his way to accommodate!

The location is excellent in Soho and the staff at the bell desk and Valet go out of their way to provide recommendations that are very good for food and or shops. Highly recommend this place.

title: Love Ian at the front desk….
text:
Ian at the front desk was amazing! So warm and welcoming. I can’t say enough about him.

Also loved our room etc which was clean, comfortable and great amenities and vintage touches! We will be back for sure!

title: Kevin gave a great check-in process and it's a great hotel!
text: Hotel is at great location, close to soho shopping areas and all the good eat out places.  hotel is clean and room is nicely organized and spacious in manhattan standard.  Kevin also made the check in process very welcoming and pleasant.  Overall good vibe for the stay.

title: Best check -in experience!!
text: I’ve stayed at this hotel several times and I’ve had several decent experiences with checking in at the front desk. This time Ian made me feel like a valued guest. Ian was courteous, welcoming and very professional.  You have an excellent employee that made an impressionable lasting impact. Don’t lose this gentleman!

title: Great service ❤️
text:
We came in without a reservation and Axel took care of us from the minute we walked in.
Best service, big room, great shower. Felt like home! 
Axel thanks again 🙏🏻❤️ 
Great view from the room as well.

title: Great location and nice rooms in the heart of soho
text: I’ve stayed at this hotel at least half a dozen times over the last few years. It’s in a great location. The rooms are clean and well equipped. The rooms vary in size, but even the smallest is ok for New York (not big, but at least decent). I’ve only really interacted with the check-in and bell staff. They definitely have a “cool” vibe. They are courteous in a very New York fashion (not overly friendly or kind, but not rude). They definitely don’t go out of their way to help you. But it’s a nice hotel and none of my go-to hotels in soho (the other being the Modernhaus, around the corner).

title: We love Soho Grand!
text: Stayed here with my children and had the most amazing visit. Breakfast at the Grand bar and salon was our favorite part of the day. Thank you to the team for such a wonderful and welcoming experience. We’ll be back!

title: Love the Soho Grand but housekeeping issues
text:
I really love this hotel- best location, cool, wonderful staff and great on-site restaurant and lounge.  That said, this trip i was a little surprised to discover that perhaps housekeeping cuts corners.  I accidentally knocked over my bottle of water so grabbed a towel to wipe the wood floor next to the bed- and was shocked to see the towel filthy dirty after simply touching the wet floor.  I actually went around to room to check - figuring it was a spill that was isolated - not happy to discover the entire wood floor filthy- as if it hadn’t seen a mop or swifter in 6 months.  

Prob need to tighten the training on housekeeping staff

title: No-Brainer: Soho Grand Hotel is my easy pick for an amazing, comfortable stay in nyc
text: The Soho Grand is exceptional. Thanks to the amazing, kind and thoughtful service, beautiful hotel and amenities, perfect location and more, the Soho Grand has become my go-to destination when visiting nyc.

title: 👍🏻👍🏻
text: Ian was fantastic from the moment of check in. He was friendly, informative, and very hospitable. View from hotel is beautiful. Love the finishes in the room. Very upscale boutique and clean! Thank you, Ian!

title: Wonderful hotel!
text: Ian P. gave us a wonderful check in after a long flight. The hotel is a great location using the A train from the airport. The room decor is very cozy.  There is a nice tropical style bar attached to the hotel as well. The staff is very friendly!  Thanks!

title: Raised the Bar
text:
The hospitality is always great at the Soho Grand. This weekend, Ian P  & Marcus M took it to another level. Their warm reception was fantastic and worth modeling by other team members. 

My wife have made this hotel our FIRST CHOICE every time we visit and will continue thanks to the wonderful service by Ian & Marcus!

title: Soho Grand is outstanding.
text:
I’ve been staying here for years. Consistent, comfortable, with an outstanding staff. 
Great location. 

Ian at the front desk is the best. 

I’ve never once had a bad experience at Soho Grand. A true example of quality & consistency.

title: NYC at it BEST!
text: The service, the location, the comfort...ticked allllll the boxes. I even left my watch and they had it Fex-Exed to me the next day! I cannot wait to come back! Thank you Marcus for helping me! -Elizabeth Donn

title: A great experience
text:
The hotel has unique special atmosphere. The service is excellent, specially Miguel in the restaurant. His attention makes one feel at home.
The room, which was a suite, was very comfortable, specifically the bed and pillows.

title: A must stay hotel
text:
As one steps out of their form of transportation arriving at the Soho Grand the magic begins. José starts your experience with a genuine smile and welcoming hug. Full disclosure: I've been a guest here before. However it never gets old getting such a wonderful welcome.

As you arrive at the front desk you can tell the level of training and detail Mr. Marcus Morales, Ms. Lauren Conolan-Richards and their team strive to achieve. Warm and engaging, genuine interest in making your stay exceptional, willing to go above and beyond.

The rooms are well appointed and very clean. The bedding is dreamy. The amenities are sufficient and the mini bar is the bomb. I had an issue with my shower that was promptly attended to.
My experience at the bar was heightened by the presence of Sean. He is one of the bartenders. He is charming and a kickass bartender. Every drink was spot on. By my second day at the bar he knew my preferences and didn't hesitate to make me feel welcome. Not usual for NYC bars these days, unfortunately. The concierge helped me with an issue that would have made my travels home a nightmare. The gentlemen did not hesitate and solved my problem. 

Being in hospitality myself, I applaud and marvel at the effort it takes to deliver exceptional hospitality. The Soho Grand management and team members do just that.

Book a room, stay a couple of nights, it well worth it

title: Amazing customer service and great room!
text: Most beautiful room with a view. As a local New Yorker out for a special evening, the Soho Grand truly delivered. Ian at the front desk was particularly accommodating when I checked in and went above and beyond to answer all my requests, with a smile. Can’t wait to repeat the experience!

title: World class hospitality
text: Unbelievable hospitality at the soho grand, thanks to Axel and Ian. My flight home from NY was cancelled last minute so I booked myself a room on a whim while I figured out my plan B. Axel was so kind and friendly when I was checking in and helpful in getting me situated, he totally turned my day around. After dinner, I went to the check in desk again for help deciding where to go. Ian went above and beyond to make me and my sister (who lives in NY) feel welcome. Had a wonderful stay here—what started out as a travel snafu ended up as an excellent extension of my trip. Would certainly stay here again and recommend this hotel highly. World class.

title: Top notch in every way!
text:
I travel to NY frequently and this may be my favorite hotel yet! The location can't be beat - several subway lines close by, fabulous coffee, bar, and nightclub affiliated with the hotel, and lots of inexpensive food options and fabulous shopping on the same block. Walking around by myself at night as a woman felt safe. 
The hotel staff is incredibly friendly, and the rooms are very chic and well-appointed. I've been staying here since they opened almost 30 years ago and I always feel cooler when I walk in the front door.

title: Comfort, Style and Excellence at the Soho Grand Hotel
text:
The Soho Grand has remained an iconic boutique hotel experience. The service is exceptional. Everyone we encountered was polite, helpful and engaging. We were repeat visitors and were so surprised when a bottle of Prosecco was delivered along with a note saying "welcome back to the big apple." 

We had drinks at the lovely bar one hot afternoon while reading magazines. We also had breakfast a couple of the mornings. The food and drinks were delicious.

Our room was a fairly nice size and worked well for 2 people. The bed is incredibly comfortable and we slept well. The shower had good water pressure and the water was as hot as we wanted it. 

The location is perfect if you like the West Village, Soho, Chelsea, Notlita, LES, and even the Financial District. We like to walk and over 4 days we covered about 20 miles on foot. We went to the Metropolitan Museum of Art to see the Karl Lagerfeld and Richard Avedon installations on day. The Spring Street subway station is very close by and very convenient if you want to take the 6 uptown.

We look forward to returning as soon as we can! We really love NYC and are happy to have a "home base" at the Soho Grand when we are in town.

title: Perfect!
text: We had a great little romantic getaway here, and will definitely stay again! Yes, rooms are on the smaller side, but are beautiful and thoughtfully appointed. All staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. It's a lovely oasis of comfort in a fun neighborhood.

title: Still got it
text:
I’ve stayed here many times so it’s become very familiar for me. To be fair, I didn’t really use a lot of services to test the hotel properly but what I did have was all excellent.
It’s an unbeatable location as far as I’m concerned.  Check in/out was slick as usual. 
I actually think the rooms have been smartened up a bit.  In fact the whole place felt sharper in some way.
It started to get a bit tatty even pre Covid.
I could not find fault in anything.
Not only would I stay again, I am doing in 3 weeks.

title: Great stay and great service
text: The check in experience was first rate, Axel was so great to us! The room as fabulous, we had a wonderful stay. I’m glad we decided to book the Soho Grand to celebrate our wedding anniversary and we may make this a tradition in the coming years. I would definitely recommend.

title: Great experience
text: Great hotel! The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are big for New York standards and the bar menu is great. It's in a perfect location in the heart of soho. Very walkable. I've stayed there a few times before and will definitely stay again.

title: Back again and again!
text: People are over friendly and genuine. Coming from Columbus, Ohio, that is very refreshing. Doorman asks where we are going for the day and always welcomes us back.  The Soho Diner is the place to get your breakfast and have a perfect drink at the same time. The best NY Olde Fashioned in the city, hands down. Doesn’t matter who makes it, it always is perfect!  Thank you to Aaron for making each visit feel like we’re special!  You are why we return!  Remington in the Grand Bar and Salon cannot be beat when it comes to making a person feel welcome when they arrive. Thank you, Remington!  The rooms are impeccably clean and service is complete right away. Mini bar is packed with everything you need. The grand bar and salon is a hopping place in the evening with music and plenty of great service. We have been coming to the city for 9 years to visit our son, and he mentioned this visit was the best hotel we’ve stayed at over the years. Thank you, everyone, for making us feel welcome when we come to New York!

title: Amazing customer service and guest experience!
text: Absolutely incredible staff experience. Everyone was truly SO friendly, accommodating, and helpful. Location was perfect. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Restaurant and bar were great. Would 100% stay here again

title: Best customer experience/service
text:
first time in New York city and Soho grand was amazing, The room was great and the bed super comfortable. best customer service!! Marcus was amazing made sure I was taken care of my entire trip gave me reccomendations where to go for my first time
in NY. Also kevin and Andrew were so great and so nice, I've stayed at multiple hotels but this one was the best customer experience! Totally reccomend staying there, def coming back when i'm in NY :)

title: Amazing location for a hotel!
text:
We recently stayed in the Soho Grand Hotel when we got married in NY. We really had a good time. 

Firstly, the location is amazing. Unbeatable. In the middle of Soho, Tribeca, Greenwich village, the subway, it is a great location. The doormen were lovely. Check in was easy, but a little distracting s there was a party in the lobby (it was a Saturday night and we didn't expect it to be such a partying hotel), we expected a more old style lobby. 

We had a suite and it was amazing. Lovely cot for our daughter, lots of towels etc. On the 16th floor, so amazing view as well. Great bathroom, really comfy bed. Really good room. 

The main issue we had was the bar downstairs. Terrible service during the day. Hard to get a table, get an order in, receive the order. We stopped even considering the bar/lobby as an area for us to venture to.

Otherwise we had a lovely stay and will stay again.

title: Another wonderful stay at Soho Grand!
text: Awesome return trip to Soho Grand with my Cavapoo Oscar! Love staying at Soho Grand when visiting my kids and other family members in the city! Everyone is so friendly and helpful and they are amazing with my dog. He loves it there as much as I do and the dog park is the best! Truly my home away from home- I look forward to my next stay!

title: Excellent Customer Service from Ian!!
text: I made a reservation for a Saturday night at the Soho Grand, a last minute getaway for one night in the city.   There was a glitch in my reservation but Ian, at the front desk, got right on it and he remedied  the problem right away!   He was enthusiastic and I hung up even more excited about my stay at the Grand!  Thank you Ian!

title: Great stay
text:
Great location for our first trip to NYC for a few years and our daughters first visit.  Easy to get to all the major sights.
Lovely people and we enjoyed using the hotel bar, Gilligans outside bar and the diner.
Beds very comfortable and everything we needed in the room.
When we come back to NYC this is where we will stay.

title: Great Hotel
text: One of the best hotels and ambiences overall in NYC.  Incredible service (including the valet), great amenities, and ideal location in the heart of Soho near everything downtown.  My favorite place to stay during business trips, where you can get work done and also play.

title: Bellissimo hotel
text: Bellissimo hotel. Vale la pena dormire qui. Camere silenziose, forse non pulite a dovere. Ho trovato che ci fosse un eccesso di polvere, ma nel complesso grande struttura. Il bar accanto è delizioso, in stile anni 50. Di colpo sembra di stare in una puntata di happy days

title: Enjoyable Stay
text:
It was a short stay to meet up with Friends who were also staying there . The location is amazing , the staff were a delight and very helpful . The Room was very comfortable although small to my liking , but had everything that you need within reach . The best feature is the bed . It was the most comfortable bed I slept in . It was heavenly . The hotel lobby and Bar area are fun they become lively in the evening with a live DJ . 
I would definitely stay there again 😀

title: Just fine. Nothing special. Great location.
text: Super confused by the five star reviews. This hotel is fine. It’s definitely outdated and needs a revamp. Staff is lukewarm and not welcoming at all. Every interaction seems like a giant bore for them.  That goes for every person from Concierge to check-in to the restaurant staff, with the exception of Remington, the host at the restaurant - he is absolutely delightful.  The room was fine, beds were very comfy. We booked the two bedroom suite, which is not an accurate description. It’s a one bedroom suite with adjoining room, so it didn’t have the open feel that you would expect from a two bedroom suite.

title: Perfect Hotel Stay
text:
The hotel staff where welcoming and made us feel like we were VIP's 

The rooms are beautiful and the beds where so comfortable that I slept better than when I am at home.

Really enjoyed our stay. It's our spot now whenever we are in NYC

title: Wonderful Team
text: Every staff member I encountered on this property, was absolutely wonderful! From check in, to the bar, to the doormen, to in room dining, every interaction was positive and genuine. I am looking forward to my next visit!

title: My amazing experience at the Soho Grand Hotel
text: I love the elegance and charm of the hotel . Very vintage and chic and provides the guests with a true NYC experience . The attention to detail in the room exceeded my expectation; well stocked supplies , cleanliness and the aesthetics i.e, bedding made the stay extremely restless . Finally , the staff , courteous prompt response to our needs , outstanding customer service and personable , warm and friendly exchanges made our stay exceptional !  . I’ve been travelling to NYC for over 20 years and always stay in Manhattan. The Soho Grand  Hotel has been my best hotel experience to date

title: Great stay - thank you Soho Grand team!
text:
Wonderful hotel that indexes on all the right things - great location, comfortable beds, relatively spacious rooms, modern amenities and a standout staff.

Would 100% stay here again! I didn't get to check out the restaurants but will make sure to do so next time.

title: Good Hotel!
text: Soho Grand Hotel is really beautiful, central and modern. Upon our arrival we were greeted with great kindness and professionalism. The room was angular and I see the New York skyline. Nighttime hotel is a landmark for all new yorkers. I will definitely come back.

title: Great getaway!
text:
The SoHo Grand hotel is the best!  So many reasons - 
1. Location:  Quick and easy access to so many interesting neighborhoods - Soho, Tribeca, Greenwich Village LES, etc.....
2. People watching: Celebrity sightings are commonplace
3. The rooms: Our one bedroom terrace suite was one of the nicest hotel rooms we've stayed in - anywhere...
4. The food: Not just at the hotel but the whole immediate neighborhood, an incredible variety of awesome options.
This wasn't our first stay here and definitely wont be our last

title: Incredible Stay at the Soho Grand!
text: I absolutely adore this hotel honestly, even as a native New Yorker. It’s chic and elevated, the drinks and atmosphere are amazing and in regards to the rooms themselves I’ve always encountered genuinely great service at the front desk and the rooms are cozy! Special shout out to Andrew, Kevin & Summer, they are top notch when it comes to efficient and attentive hospitality. I recommend this hotel to everyone I know who’s coming into town or New Yorkers looking for a staycation. 10/10!

title: Amazing As Always!!!
text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for his Birthday Celebration! As always, the hotel did not disappoint!! From the moment we came upon the hotel entry door, we were graciously greeted with their trademark professional door-opening service. Check-In was a breeze and we were gifted with free breakfast coupons and a nice glass of Prosecco. The room was spectacular with a wonderful view of West Broadway, which I feel is the heart and soul of the Soho area. A huge TV and a Spacious Walk-In Shower were just few of the fantastic room amenities provided.  Upon returning to our room in the evening, we were happily greeted with a bottle of wine, wine glasses and a special birthday wish note from the hotel!!!  Check-Out was a breeze!!  Kudos to All the Staff at the Soho Grand. With a Special “Shout-Out” to Axel, Remington and Andrew!!

title: Our favourite in NYC
text: The Soho Grand is our absolute favourite. Everything about the experience is pitch-perfect, from the overall vibe to the exceptional staff and customer service. The hotel bar is perfect for drinks at the end of the night, and we always start our day with breakfast at the diner. The location can’t be beat. Highly recommend.

title: Must Stay Soho Grand Hotel Is The Best
text: Overall our stay was great. Very clean, comfy yet stylish rooms, great location can walk to everything, amazing customer service, delicious food and drinks and lots of fun programming for guests to enjoy. What really stood out was Andrew and Axel at the front desk. They provided a level of customer service that was fantastic. They were so helpful, informative, funny and friendly. We can't say enough good things about Andrew, Axel and the hotel as a whole.

title: Excellent hotel.
text:
The hotel is consistently fabulous.  A great neighborhood, a lovely staff, and a warm and inviting experience - EVERY.  SINGLE.  TIME.

From the glass of Prosecco that greets you at check-in to the kind and courteous staff as you check out, along with everything in between, it's a true gem in Manhattan.

title: The Grandest!!
text: My husband and I went for our anniversary. Our son lives in the city so we visit often. The Soho Grand is by far the grandest!  From the doorman to the staff at the diner, everyone is friendly. Soho Diner has the friendliest staff, remembering us each time we visited.  Also they make the best Old Fashioned!  The Grand Bar and Salon  is relaxing with fantastic drinks and food along with fabulous staff. Thank you to Remington for making our visit one of the best we’ve had in New York. We cannot wait to come back. The bed and pillows were the most comfortable we’ve experienced. A much need perfect night’s sleep. Thank you, again, to everyone at the Soho Grand!

title: Underwhelmed
text:
Underwhelmed. 

Based on reviews, was expecting a little better.  Was going for a great SOHO hotel. 

Lots of nice touches but overpriced for what you get.  Maybe this is NYC?

Pros—Prosecco at check in. Great location. On-site bar but…see cons.  I’ll revise if I find more. 

Cons:
Bellhop who wrested my luggage from me to carry it up stairs even though 1. I said I wanted to handle my own luggage, 2. There was a ramp. 
Indifferent service . Watched 4 of 5 bar staff ignore patrons for over 50 minutes while they hung out chatting amongst themselves. 
Overpriced, mediocre snacks that would be modest giveaways at other bars. 
Low lighting everywhere which may offer sift complimentary lighting but honestly is terribly dim and somewhat gaslighted. 
For sure I am biased paying a premium.  I have had far better for less in Palm Springs/Palm Desserr/Indian Wells, Conrad LA, 4 Seasons Morocco, Lake Tahoe, Paris, London, Rome.

title: WORSE HOSPITALITY EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE
text:
We honestly had the worse experience in terms of service and day-to-day operations. We stayed there for almost two weeks at their Loft South penthouse suite, and it didn't feel like a proper hotel because of the low level of concierge, sales, and front desk services. 

The property is very poorly run, and it shows by the fact that it requires us to call them multiple times to get things done every day and it was exhausting! If we are paying this amount of money, the service needs to be up to speed and personalized based on our needs. Their response rate was very poor to the extent that they forgot to extend our stay, and we needed to leave the penthouse within two hours and find something else while packing to get out of the hotel for not being penalized if staying more than our contract. They never found a solution that would be reasonable for us and never apologized! The hotel's culture is based on making excuses and avoiding responsibility all the time rather than being a solution-oriented and empathetic environment. 

The gym was very small, and the service team was rude overall. 

The only good thing about this hotel is its location, and that's about it! 

I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a long stay and a top-tier luxury experience. 

You should do better because the property has a really good potential.

title: NYC’s BEST!
text:
The Soho Grand team makes the hotel experience feel like home away from home…my favorite hotel in NYC! 

From arrival, to check in, to lounge + dining + drinks Soho Grand always exceeds expectations…looking forward to my next stay!

title: Un ottimo hotel nel cuore di SoHo
text:
Ottimo hotel nel cuore di SoHo, un quartiere di New York caratterizzto da case, fabbriche e magazzini del XIX secolo, con le   facciate in mattoni rossi e ghisa, e le tipiche scale anticendio esterne. Gran parte degli edifici storici è stata ristrutturata e riconvertita in spazi pubblici o privati. Le architetture, le strade lastricate, alcune di esse anche alberate, contribuiscono a creare un'atmosfera davvero unica e originale, 100% New York City. I numerosi negozi, molti di fascia alta, i tanti bar, i ristoranti e le gallerie d'arte fanno di SoHo anche una meta ambita per lo shopping e il divertimento.

Il SoHo Grand Hotel si integra perfettamente in questa atmosfera, rilassata, orignale e attenta anche alla forma.

Ho soggiornato al SoHo Grand per due giorni, viaggiavo sola, e ho apprezzato:
- la cortesia e la disponibilità di tutto il personale;
- la camera da letto pulita e ampia - per gli standard di New York - senza moquette,
ben corredata e decorata con dettagli originali, ma di buon gusto. Letto
comodissimo;
- il lounge bar-ristorante, dove vengono serviti colazione, pranzo, cena, bevande e
cocktail in un ampio e luminoso spazio, caratterizzato da grandi vetrate. Frequentato
anche da clienti esterni, il lounge offre  un'atmosfera rilassata durante il giorno, che si fa   più vibrante alla sera;
- il secondo ristorante all'interno dell'hotel, chiamato Club Room, aperto solo per cena 
e con ambientazione stile primi decenni del '900, dove in alcune serate è possibile
bere o cenare ascoltando musica dal vivo. Enrambi i ristoranti offrono una carta non
troppo ampia ma soddisfacente, il menu si ispira alla cucina dei bistrot.

L'hotel offre ai propri ospiti wifi gratuito e mette a loro disposizione anche delle biciclette, non so dire se gratuitamente o a pagamento perché non ho utilizzato questo servizio.

Viaggiavo sola e mi sono sentita sicura e ottimamente servita in questo hotel dal carattere originale e dallo spirito accogliente.

title: Highly Recommend the Soho Grand!
text: The Soho Grand is a beautiful hotel with a courteous and professional staff.  Our view from the 10th floor was spectacular.  The room was very comfortable and clean. The Soho location was perfect to experience New York!  Lovely shops all around and top notch dining!  We will be back!

title: Will stay again and again
text:
Pros: 
-Location. Surrounded by our favorite parts of Manhattan and very convenient location to multiple subway lines. 
-The rooms are spacious by NYC standards and have great amenities. The beds and pillows are some of the most comfortable I've experienced at a hotel. 
-The staff is very welcoming and go out of their way to make sure you're comfortable. 
-Room service was delivered fast. 
-I appreciated the complimentary glass of prosecco upon check in. 
-Overall feel very safe staying here. 
-The complimentary umbrella in our room came in handy on a rainy day. 

Cons: 
-Almost none except the street was very noisy in the middle of the night with lots of car horns. Recommend bringing a portable white noise machine with you if your room faces W Broadway, that helped us a great deal.

title: Always an experience
text: It'd been a year since I've been to Soho Grand but they recognized me at the front desk from a year ago, upgraded my room and have been very helpful with everything. The bar and the lounge was great as always. Spectacular views of NY from the upper floors. There's always something that makes you come back to Soho Grand.

title: Our experience staying at the Soho Grand Hotel was beyond perfect! I highly recommend staying at this hotel! 5 stars!
text: Our experience with the Soho Grand was beyond our expectations. The rooms were great. The diner was great. The employees were amazing and very professional. I highly  recommend staying there. We are already planning our next vacation at the Soho Grand. 5 ⭐️

title: Supreme Stay at Soho Grand Hotel
text:
I had an April trip planned to New York. I had a superb stay at Soho Grand Hotel.  I chose Soho Grand Hotel, because the service is impeccable, the room was impeccably clean. the staff provide excellent service in hospitality. The hotel location is ideal for shopping, dining and close to many tourist attractions. The neighborhood is extremely quiet which makes for a perfect nights sleep. 
Soho Grand Hotel offers many wonderful amenities: If you don't feel like dining out, the hotel has a lovely restaurant called the Soho Diner which has inside seating & an outside garden area, the menu has a nice variety of food selections &  great ambience. Incredibly designed . The Salon also offers a wonderful array of food choices with a hip vibe. 
Tip: Inquire if a room is available facing the Soho Grand Dog park, its such a treat to observe the dogs frolicking in lovely garden setting. In addition one can also see the Empire State Building & the Chrysler Building.

title: #1 downtown Manhattan hotel
text: Best hotel ever 😍 elegant, historic, good vibe at night, romantic ambiance in the evening. Lovely bar and fare. The downtown spot to be. Rooms take you back to another era. Definitely check out soho diner next door as well

title: Great Stay
text: The hotel was beaufitul and the staff was very friendly.  I really only interacted with the check-in desk and the bartender but they were both super nice and made my stay. For being in NYC, the rooms are expected to be small, but the room was very well set-up and comfortable with nice furniture.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: My favorite NYC Hotel
text:
Love this hotel,  great location, quiet, comfortable beds, wonderful amenities and fabulous customer service.
The Soho Hotel treats their guest with warmth, grace and elegant style.  I can hardly wait to my next visit to New York and 
This incredible hotel.

title: Great Hotel - understaffed
text:
I love this hotel and have stayed here numerous times.  This visit fell a bit short sadly.  First the positives: my room was exactly as expected- clean and well appointed and ready upon arrival even tho I was 3 hours before check in; the common areas clean, gym great.  Sadly- there were some negatives this trip: 1) people staying with pets not being informed their pet MUST be leashes - some dog covered my trousers with pet hair in the elevator; 2) the hotel bar where I met my client for a drink- had one waiter for 15-20 tables- he was CLEARLY in the weeds - couldn’t get his attention for drinks or the check (the hostess had to take care of the drinks and after 15 minutes I just told the hostess to put the drinks on my room)- I was surprised to see a 20% service charge for the drinks when the service was truly sub-par.  3) i mentioned a mistake on Expedia’s website regarding “free parking” which I knew to be an error; when I mentioned it to the front desk person on checkout he was almost condescending in the way he told me “you must have been looking at a different hotel”- lol.  Not my problem pal- just being a nice person so u could mention it to someone in authority to correct the problem.  That said- CLEARLY that front desk person missed some training on the days ‘courtesy’ was taught.

Overall, I still enjoy this hotel, but slipped a tad on this past visit

title: Room was clean but the noise from the 2nd is not acceptable for the amount charged.
text: The room  is clean, the biggest is the second floor on Saturday night is used as a night club so unless you get a room 7th floor, the noise resonates. Additionally we had issues with our shower and air conditioner that were not adequately addressed

title: White glove service without exception
text: First time staying at Soho Grand Hotel. It will not be the last. Outstanding service. White glove treatment from arrival to departure. The hotel staff made sure I did not want for anything, All requests were met with a quick response.  Concierge made wonderful suggestions for local fine dining and alike.The room was spacious and quiet.  Conversely, the lobby was upbeat with a lounge for gatherings, with a DJ!  The retro diner was  inviting with its warm color desgin and friendly staff. Morning coffee there, started my day right. SGH made my business trip into a leisurely one. The best magic trick of of all.

title: Poor customer service and dirty bathrooms
text:
Lauren, It is very disappointing the experience my wife and I had at your property. Here are the details:

1) I asked three times to get my shower unclogged and it was never fixed. I was there for four nights and every day in the morning I would ask for someone to come up to my room and fix the shower. It was very unpleasant to take showers and have the tub get filled with dirty water as the drains were not working correctly.

2) The waiter in the restaurant was extremely rude to my wife and I. We had issues with him for all four days. On the last day I had a big argument with him because he kept on asking me for a breakfast voucher and I did not have one. I do not understand why he could not simply charge what I ordered to my room or have me pay with a credit card. He was loud and very unwelcoming.

I did not catch his name, but he was a short man with a heavy accent and about 220lb.

3) The bell person that was at the entrance of the hotel on Wednesday April 12 at around 2 PM was extremely rude. He kept asking me how much I was paying for the ride to JFK and was trying to look at my phone. He then tells me that he has been working there for 27 years and that I should not get upset with him. How could I not get upset if he is trying to sell me some bogus JJK ride and trying to look at my phone uninvited?  

He then proceeded to take my luggage and threw it unordered in the back of the vehicle that I had reserved. It was a very intimidating situation.

You should really watch the kind of people you have serving there. There are many hotels in NY and with the service you are giving people, one would not come back.

title: Soho Grand…. Grand indeed….
text:
Ok..  so..  i think i may have found my new home away from home in NYC.  First i love to stay down in SOHO..   it allows me to get away at the end of the day and chill….  
When i got there they were great..   first.. let’s start with the upgrade….  Ended up on the 14th floor….  That was lovely…. Front desk guy (sadly.. i can not remember his name…. And need to find out.. ). Went above and beyond every time i needed something 

Got to my room..   very comfortable..   they were able to accommodate my weird quirk of having 8 pillows..  (yeah.. don’t ask)..  

Dinner that first night in the Soho diner..   was fab..   (get the Mac and cheese… it is tooooo die for)….
