Was out back to the airport Wednesday (yeah..  very fast trip)..  the door guys..  off the charts helpful…. (Thanks Jose for the car situation getting taken care of)…. 

On the flight back to Los Angeles already looking at the schedule for my next trip out..   looking forward to when i am able to stay in one of the terrace penthouses…. (I may never leave it that is the case…. ).

title: Comfortable & Well Located Soho Stay
text: Fantastic location, clean and well furnished. I loved the amount of counter space in the bathroom and the option of a black out curtain.  All employees we interacted with were very helpful and friendly.  We had not realized that this is a very popular place to go out on the weekend, and as we were on the lowest floor, the loud music was not ideal on our first night.  However, we requested to switch rooms and were promptly accommodated.  They even moved our bags for us while we were out. Highly recommend!

title: Great hotel, location, staff, etc.
text:
We frequent Soho and have stayed at a variety of hotels in the area.  Soho Grand will be our go to hotel from now on.  The location was great and convenient.  We had an issue with our airlines cancelling our flights on multiple days... the front desk team could not have been more helpful on helping us extend our stay.

Upon arrival (we were three hours pre-check in time) we ate in the restaurant and had some of the best avocado toast ever (along with some champagne).  We had barely finished our lunch and we received a notice saying our room was ready (this made us very happy).  We also swung into the bar on a few of the nights for a nightcap... and the bartenders make a mean lemon drop martini...in addition to having some great bourbons.

title: Love Soho Grand!
text: We have been staying at the Soho Grand for the last 14 years, since our daughter moved to NYC (Soho and now Noho). The Soho Grand staff is friendly and helpful, the atmosphere is fun, and the Diner is great (inside and outside). We have always enjoyed cocktails in the Grand Bar and Salon. Our accommodations are always comfortable and clean. We wouldn't stay anywhere else.

title: Favorite Hotel in NYC
text: The service is spot on from the minute you pull up to the Soho Grand. The door men are warm and welcoming and always open the door as you enter. The concierge is most helpful, and the front desk is always so gracious at check-in. It has super cool vibes with low lighting and great music coming from the lounge. The rooms are always immaculate with all the amenities you need. The beds and bedding are simply luxurious. The location is excellent for all the shopping and dining in Soho as well as easy access to the Holland tunnel. They also offer bicycles in the summer. Truly our favorite place to stay in NYC!!

title: Jazz Bar en el Soho
text: Llegamos de casualidad porque íbamos al restaurante que está enfrente y decidimos tomar una copa en este bar. Nos encantó la decoración y el ambiente tradicionales de jazz bar, con música de calidad en directo. Servicio excelente. Ideal para relajarse.

title: One Night Bachelorette Celebration in NYC
text: I stayed at the Soho Grand at the end of March for one night to celebrate my best friend’s bachelorette party.  We are native New Yorkers and moms in our forties and we wanted to find a place that would make our friend feel super special for our one night out.  The Soho Grand did not disappoint! From the second we arrived every employee at the hotel was super welcoming and polite! It felt like a little vacation even though we were close to home.  The hotel has an awesome vibe and you don’t need to venture out of the hotel for entertainment.  The lobby bar is a scene during the day and night and although we didn’t go to the club in the hotel, it definitely seemed to be a fun place to party at night. The best part of it all was how well we were taken care of by Andrew Alvalles, the front office supervisor.  He ensured that we had a wonderful experience and our room was absolutely stunning!!! We had such a great experience that we have decided to visit again soon and enjoy all this hotel has to offer.  If you are traveling to NYC from another location or if you from NY and are looking to have a little “staycation” I highly suggest staying here! You won’t be disappointed!

title: Great hotel
text: The Grand Soho Hotel offers luxurious and comfortable accommodation in the heart of vibrant SoHo. The rooms are well-appointed, and the rooftop terrace provides stunning views of the city skyline. The staff is friendly and attentive, making for a memorable stay.

title: Love Soho Grand Hotel
text: Fabulous vibe at this Hotel. Doorman always give you a warm welcome. Cocktails at the bar are fabulous, great club and then there's the great Diner on the street. All staff are happy to help you. Beds are comfy. The location is fantastic with the buzz of Soho at your doorstep. Restaurants and shopping all amazing.

title: Soho grand experience
text: We arrived late due to our flight from the UK and we were first meet by Byron who guided us to reception and waiting to make sure we were seen. The receptionist Kiara and Genesis couldn’t have been more helpful checking us in and making sure we had everything before going to bed. Our room is fully equipped and very comfy bed. Loving our trip so far.

title: Great staff
text: The night staff is great. Genesis and Kiara at the front desk were amazing and super helpful. I will be back to visit. The hotel was nice and  clean when i arrived late and i appreciate the service from staff.

title: Enjoyable experience
text: My time at The Grand Soho was wonderful!! We chose this hotel to celebrate our 40th anniversary, and we were greeted with a bottle of champagne in our beautiful room upon arrival. Although the room was on the smaller side, it was comfortable, clean and it had a beautiful view of the city. This marked our second visit to The Grand Soho Hotel, and it certainly won't be our last!"

title: Soho Grand is truly GRAND
text:
Soho Grand is truly a GRAND experience in NYC! I loved staying in the Soho area, and the Soho Grand is a perfect location. Close to the subway and walkable to my favorite spots in town, whether you're going to Soho, Greenwhich Village, or even down to Brooklyn area. 

Bar is 10/10
Decor/Vibe is 10/10

And the best place to stay for a night cap because the place is popping for night life. 

Can't wait to come back to Soho Grand!

title: Poor/Unprofessional customer service
text: I live a few blocks away in SOHO and I know the hotel is amazing.  I was hoping to host a family party for my sons' graduation in one of their event spaces.  I called the general event number 212 965 3500 and spoke to someone who identified herself as Nicole.  I inquired about the event space guest capacity and told her I would tailor the guest list based on the capacity of the space that was available.  I also asked which room was available on my desired date.  As the inquiries went on, Nicole grew very frustrated and hung up the phone.  I believe the hotel should not have individuals answering the phone designated for events by someone who is not equipped to answer questions, gets easily frustrated and is unprofessional.  I hope to be contacted by the General Manager to discuss my event further.

title: Great Vibes!
text:
We had an amazing stay. Friendly staff and great food! The vibe of the hotel is the best part from a sophisticated lobby bar to relax and socialize or a night club for the late night win. 

Thank you Peter for such a warm welcome! See you in the Fall!

title: Beautiful hotel with a great location
text: Beautiful hotel with a great location. The staff was so friendly and conscientious. The rooms are well equipped and nicely styled. Loved the interiors - especially the old subway steps at the entrance.

title: Great anniversary
text: Incredible staff- from the door man to the bellhop and especially the front desk. They were absolutely wonderful.  We arrived after a hectic travel day and they could not have been more welcoming. The room was clean and  well appointed. Great location. Many great restaurants within an easy walk.

title: Great hotel in great area
text:
Great hotel , in a great location to visit New York . Near Chinatown. 
Rooms are very good for NYC , very clean , bed very large and comfortable. Pets Allowed and got a park to walk them for guests . 
Breakfast wasn’t amazing and service slow . But plenty of other choice we didn’t try . So to be tried .! 
There is a diner part of the hotel that we didn’t try . Also a great delicatessen next door. 
Service at the entrance was very good . Doormen were super friendly , and reception was very nice and check in and out were very fast . 
 Overall I recommend and will stay there on my next visit to NYC

title: Wonderful Weekend.!
text:
I read through the negative reviews to better understand why the 3.5 rating on Yelp... honestly our stay was exceptional- to the point where at certain moments it feels like a 5 star hotel... Prosecco upon checkin, early check in if they have enough rooms,  great doormen who get your bags and take them to your room in a super busy area... this one doorman had been working there two decades !! He was fabulous and I wish I remembered his name... 

From my first phone connection with Mark Perez asking that our Amex room upgrade please be denoted, I was impressed... he asked about our trip and I explained it was an auspicious time of year as Persian new year and we were meeting family- then also as a front line worker feeling burnt out and ready to unplug... he shared his wife is also a therapist and he understood ... upon checking in Andrew made us feel like family and Genesis was a doll with our various questions ... the room and bottle of wine with gorgeous card brought tears to our eyes- when your job is to care for others being cared for means a lot !! 

We ate at all three spots (diner / lounge / jazz club) and they were all tasty and fresh flavors- drinks were excellent !!  Music from DJ in lobby bar and jazz in jazz club where fabulous!!!! No cover charge !!! Just table time limits which are fair. 

We fell in love and will be back - PLUS- they allow dogs !!!

title: A Delightfully Friendly Hotel
text: I recently stayed at the Soho Grand Hotel for a short business trip. I stayed two nights and thoroughly enjoyed my experiences with the hotel.  Check in was quick and flawless, my room was clean and inviting.  I had a view of the hotels dog park from my room and though I didn't have dogs with me, I appreciated how dog friendly this hotel is.  I ate breakfast in the Grand Bar both mornings and the food came out quickly and was delicious. The service was friendly and attentive. I ordered room service (also from the Grand Bar) for dinner on my second night and was surprised by how quickly it arrived.  One of the best French Onion Soups I've ever had!  Too soon my stay was over and check out was as efficient as check in and the men on the doors went above and beyond.  I can't wait to go back!

title: Wonderful service, rooms and views. Excellent place to stay in NYC!
text:
Absolutely stunning hotel in the heart of everything. Perfectly sized rooms and comfortable beds with incredible amenities, service and views! From the moment we arrived, we were treated incredibly well, despite having to stand around for 10 minutes while we were on hold with the bank as they froze our Visa! They were very patient with us and got us a table with some water. 

Bonus points are that it is dog-friendly. We did not travel with our dog, but got our fill by also visiting the Best Friends Animal Shelter across the road. 

We were moments from shopping, dining, drinks, and entertainment, and will definitely choose this spot as our next hotel stay when we are in NYC!

title: Excellent service and beautiful rooms
text:
The rooms were so big compared to most NYC hotels that I've stayed in. The hardware and amenities were fantastic and definitely worth the price.

Also the staff is insanely attentive and went out of their way to help me wrap a gift at the last minute.

title: Beautiful hotel but some flaws
text: The room and building were beautiful and chic. But the walls are thin enough that I heard a dog barking next door for most of the night, a generator or something like it was humming and buzzing all night which interfered with sleep, and the free wifi was not good enough to stay steady or allow us to watch Netflix as advertised. The tv setup is clumsy and difficult to use. I got the sense the mediocre wifi was in an effort to force you to pay for the more expensive wifi package. Otherwise, it’s a physically beautiful place.

title: GREEDY DOORMAN
text:
I have been to soho grand a number of times. 
For personal outings but primarily for business functions. Having spent a lot of money on both occasions. The last few times myself and my colleagues noticed that we are being charged by the doorman $100 dollars to gain entrance! Considering  how much money people spend . I find that extremely ridiculous, he is rude and extremely arbitrarily with who he makes pay and who doesn’t!  I will be taking my business elsewhere!

title: Wonderful stay, great location
text: We had a great stay. Decor was very cool. Our room was unique and had lots of amenities. The view on the corner unit was wonderful. The location is great for shopping and restaurants. Would definitely come back.

title: Stay here and look no further
text: Let me say that I don’t normally don’t do reviews but the soho grand hotel is top notch. From the moment you walk in you feel special, and are greeted with friendly people and smiles. The rooms are impeccably clean, and the staff is professional and so nice to talk to. From the moment we sat down we were greeted by Remington in the lobby and he really made our experience that much more special and welcoming. I could not pick a better place for a bachelorette. Will definitely visit again!

title: The perfect spot for an anniversary celebration!
text:
My wife and I decided Soho would be the best NYC location for an anniversary weekend celebration in mid-March. The Soho Grand proved to be the best hotel in the area (maybe in all of NYC) as they delivered at the highest level on everything. 
The prosecco and special pastry creations were a welcome surprise, and
an upgrade to room 1110 (corner views) was excellent as well.
Our anniversary stay was made all the more special by the staff's attentive and thoughtful gestures.
We are glad we stopped in at the hotel bar on 2nd fl. The bartenders are accomplished and professional, while making outstanding cocktails amidst a fabulous atmosphere.
We will always consider Soho Grand first whenever we plan future visits to NYC.
5-stars all-around.

title: Best hotel experience in New York in a while!
text: The soho grand definitely went above and beyond to accommodate my needs!  Such a sweet and kind and hard working staff.  The location is perfect if you wanna explore downtown NYC!  It’s within walking distance of all the soho galleries and shopping, and on plenty of subway lines.  It’s also a quick shot to Penn station.

title: The Best In NYC
text: Absolutely LOVE Soho Grand! This is my go to hotel in NYC.  The staff is great, the rooms are comfortable, and the overall vibe is perfect. The dog park is my pup's favorite place to be! Can't recommend enough!

title: Not worth the hype - at all
text:
The room was ok, however the reservation leading up to the stay was a nightmare.
When checking in, there was no information of the premises or services regarding breakfast, facilities, bar, food. No engagement from the staff. 
We decided to have dinner one night at the hotel, however it took 27 minutes before we got to order our drinks(we were told we only had 90 mins at the table when we got there) and the staff were disengaged aswell. A perfect example of a place that lives off of former glory. If you want to pay a lot of money for a nice location with no service- this is the place for you.
We will not stay here again.

title: Perfect Home Away from Home!
text: Cozy elegance in an ideal NYC neighborhood with staff who make you feel at home...doesn't get much better!  Great attention to detail with rooms that are clean, spacious and include thoughtful details.  The Grand Bar is the ideal place for meetings, getting work done and people watching.

title: Easy and comfortable.  I feel at home staying there!
text: Great rooms, clean and very comfortable!  Service is wonderful always.  Everyone very professional and caring!  Every time I arrive I’m greeted with a smile and an easy check in!  The bellmen go out if their way to always help me out!

title: Amazing stay!
text: Excellent customer service and attention to details. Friendly and helpful staff from the door men to the front desk! Incredibly helpful and ready to answer questions and make recommendations. The hotel has classic old NY vibes. The food is AMAZING! Cool neighborhood with great shops with some chains mixed in.

title: Mangelhaft
text:
Das personal war sehr nett, die Zimmer auch das Bad ist auch sehr schön. 
Doch das essen war so schlecht das man es kaum essen konnte. 
Das Frühstück das Ei war gefühlt verfault. Das Brot war Stein hart. 
Und der Honig grausam. 
Empfehlenswert nur wenn man nichts isst.

title: Perfect stay at Soho Grand!
text: Awesome stay at Soho Grand with my puppy Oscar. From the moment we arrived the friendly staff did everything possible to make our stay memorable - and it was. Room was lovely and quiet, Soho Diner was a great meeting spot for my kids and family who live in the NYC area and the dog park was fabulous! Absolutely loved everything about my stay and can’t wait for our next visit!

title: Perfect NYC Weekend
text:
My husband and I were looking forward to a much needed couples weekend in our favorite city!   Our first time staying at the SOHO Grand.  From the moment we arrived we were greeted by the friendliest doorman who quickly unloaded our bags and took our keys to park our car, which if you know parking in NYC, is a huge luxury!
The hotel is understated with luxurious details, a mix of both old world and contemporary design.  Just lovely!  During the course of our stay, we had a delicious breakfast in their lobby cafe with comfy couches and great people watching.  One evening before our night out, we had martinis in their beautiful bar, quite the NY nightlife scene!
Every time we needed to call down for something, it was brought up within minutes.  
Their concierge staff is so friendly and very helpful.  On our last day, Lonnie came up to help us with our luggage.   He is the sweetest most friendliest man!   This hotel knows what they are doing in employing  first rate staff!  Post Covid, this is not the norm in most places.  What a amazing way for us to sadly end our stay.  I also want to add, that Soho is the BEST neighborhood to stay in.  Over the last 25 years, we have stayed all throughout the city.  By far, Soho checks all our boxes… great shopping and dining with a great vibe!   We can’t wait to come back!!!

title: Excellent choice!
text: We had an excellent stay at the Soho Grand - it was a perfect home base for a weekend in the city. Every staff member we encountered - at check-in, in the cocktail lounge, at the concierge desk and at check-out - was so friendly and helpful. Our room was clean, comfy and had a great shower.  We love Soho for its neighborhood feel, but great restaurants, excellent shopping and endless entertainment options are minutes away. Will definitely be back!

title: Guest experience is top notch. Friendly, gracious staff!
text: The customer service and staff attentiveness were outstanding!  Every request, from extra coffee pods or a glass of Prosecco,  to finding us a place on the sofas, was met with "Yes!"  , with good cheer and friendly professionalism.  The concierge was on point, and at the door, Jose not only took care of our car, but remembered us from last year, and was genuinely interested and helpful with our plans. The room is just right, clean and cozy, love the ombre window shade!

title: Grand time at Soho Grand.
text: Excellent location. Clean room. Excellent service. Excellent Concierge. Great amenities. Great nightlife. It is easy to navigate the city from here. Great restaurants in the area. Close to the sister hotel is the ROXY where there is great jazz to be heard.

title: Great stay!!
text: SoHo Grand is a wonderful hotel in a great area; it's chic and the staff is so accommodating and friendly!  Whatever you need, they are there for.  It's lively and the rooms are incredibly nice and well maintained.

title: Lovely stay
text: Easy to get to location and base for moving around the city. Room was clean and cozy. Great water pressure in the shower. Comfortable mattress and bedding. Front desk staff were lovely to work with. Special thanks to Ricky for problem solving our request without a hitch!

title: Great rooms, dog friendly, bustling location
text:
We stayed here with our dog and were very impressed with the dog friendliness. She was very welcomed in all spaces, and enjoyed the private dog park. 
Our room was spacious and thoughtfully decorated. 
The location is convenient for getting around downtown, though very busy and bustling.

title: Winter Getaway
text: We’ve had such an amazing stay at the Soho Grand! The hotel is decorated beautifully and the rooms have spectacular views of the city. Danny helped us switch our room when there was a mixup with our check-in. He even walked with me to the new room and showed us the view of the World Trade Center right outside our window! He has been so hospitable in helping us with anything we needed during our trip. Thank you for hosting us and being so gracious! We will definitely stay here again in the future! I highly recommend the Soho Grand when staying in Manhattan.

title: Perfect location and plenty of soul
text:
Having decided to stay in Soho, this hotel ticked the right boxes for us - it is very well located, being near to the shops around Broadway, the restaurants around Spring Street, Tribeca and the financial district.  

The hotel itself has lots of soul and you feel that the moment you walk in - the atmosphere is dark and nicely lit with a quirky, cool atmosphere and decor/furnishings to match.  The staff were helpful - especially the friendly doormen - and they were happy to help with complementary essential toiletries when the airline lost our luggage which was really appreciated.

We were on a budget and so didn't eat and drink much at the hotel itself.  We had a drink at the hotel bar on Saturday night which was fantastic although expensive.  There are food and coffee places round the corner which we used a few times to keep costs down.  We like to run and it's easy to get down to the riverside by West Street for scenic runs towards or away from World Trade Center and Battery Park.

We did note that - especially in the corrodors - if the lights had been bright they would have exposed corridors that need some love from the decoarion perspective, but the room itself was nice so it didn't really matter to us.  If you're looking for a perfect finish or  modern decor this may not be your place, but if you are looking for character and a great location you'll probably like it.  Overall we really enjoyed it and would go back.

title: A Grand Old Time
text: The SOHO Grand is everything a SOHO hotel should be - super chic and a ton of fun, with fantastic service to boot. All of the staff was warm and welcoming and happy to help answer any of my questions. The room had a great view looking uptown, with luxurious amenities. There are tons of shops and restaurants within walking distance so you will have a great time even when its 10 degrees outside. I will definitely be coming back!

title: I want to go back!
text: I booked a last minute stay at Soho grand and am so glad I did. The hotel was beautiful, clean, central to everything and the vibes were immaculate. The staff was very kind and helpful. Kiara at the front desk was an absolute pleasure and made me feel right at home. I had such a lovely experience and  can't wait to go back. ALSO if you're a foodie like I am, the food was so good!! Make sure you try the BLT from here with fries...and the chocolate treats, and the omelets, and green juice - all of it- phenomenal.

title: Fantastic!
text:
The property, rooms, vibe and staff are all fantastic! The location couldn't be any better or cooler. 

I've stayed at the Soho Grand many times and each stay has been fantastic. It's become my "home away from home" while visiting NYC.

title: Amazing!
text: I absolutely love Soho Grand. I go to NYC for a week every month and it's the only place I stay. Clean, friendly staff, and great location. Stephanie and Melody have been so helpful and such a pleasure to work with. All of the door/ front desk staff are great too! Top notch customer service- they're amazing.

title: Perfect SoHo hotel
text: Luxurious accommodations, attentive staff, stylish decor, and positive vibes conspire to make this the perfect SoHo place to stay!  I return to this hotel on every trip to NYC, and I look forward to my next stay!

title: Exceeded High Expectations!
text:
I live in the NYC area and was looking for a hotel to invite my partners and clients to stay when coming to NYC for meetings and events. Though I know NYC well, having lived there for 20+ years, I hadn't the need to stay in hotels there. I can recommend hotels in many other cities around the world but not in the city I call home!  

I had heard much about the Soho Grand over the years, all rave reviews, so I decided to see for myself before I endorsed it to my colleagues.

My very high expectations were exceeded the moment I pulled up to the hotel...happy that the valet parking experience (my first time in NYC) mirrored that of any other valet parking experience I had in the past and so, with the parking headache eliminated, things only got better from there. 

The design of the hotel is stunning and the check-in process was flawless and the room was perfect. I particularly appreciated that even though the hotel is relatively new, it had so many classic touches such as high ceilings, plenty of light, impressive attention to detail and, best of all, an overwhelmingly upbeat and attentive staff. 

Though mine was a short visit, I am confident that for even longer stays, the Soho Grand will be the perfect NYC hotel for me, my colleagues and my clients.

One last thing: Ollie did not join me on this visit...but he would have been totally welcome as the Soho Grand is dog friendly and provides an adjacent dog park...which is not easy to find in that part of NYC!

title: Fabulous time
text: The soho was absolutely breathtaking and we had such a good time. The staff was beyond helpful and so professional we will be coming back sooner than later. The room was so clean and everything you can possible need was in the room.

title: Great weekend getaway at the Soho Grand
text: We had a great weekend getaway in Manhattan at the Soho Grand; from the moment we were greeted at the entrance until check out we felt special.  Check in was easy and actually fun, great energy and everyone super friendly.  The atmosphere is very chic trendy and warm at the same time. Michael checked us in and was wonderful, we were offered complimentary prosecco, which we enjoyed very much.  During check in Michael was engaging and sincerely interested in our plans; when I mentioned we were locals celebrating a covid delayed anniversary weekend we were greeted in our room with a beautiful note and bottle of prosecco.  Our room upgrade was perfect with a lot of nice touches and beautiful northern city view; the bed was amazing and we appreciated the blackout shades.  There were plenty of options for food and drinks right in the hotel, we really enjoyed breakfast in the restaurant in the morning and cocktails in the lounge with live dj at night until the wee hours.  They have a very cool retro diner we hope to try on our next visit.  The area is perfect to visit lower Manhattan and easy to access the theater district, subway around the corner and always a cab standing by outside.

title: Would have been a 5 rating if it wasn't for the disappointing bar experience
text:
So... there are lots of great things about this hotel. The location in particular is superb - easy walking distance to lots of places like Ground Zero, Brooklyn Bridge, and all of the cool neighbourhoods like Little Italy, Chinatown etc. Right next door to Canal St subway to take you uptown. The rooms were a good size and the beds really comfortable. Bathrooms were very nice and spacious - although the shower did seem to take an age to get hot.  If you get a room on the north side of the hotel there are great views too. 
We were a party of 6 - my husband and I (and our two children and their partners (all in their mid 20s), we chose the hotel because of the DJ and cool bar/lounge of a weekend. We thought it would be great for them ( and us) to hang out after we'd been out in the evening. HOWEVER - of the four nights we were there we only managed to secure a table at the bar once. It is clearly a very popular night out for local New Yorkers and there were queues to get into the hotel on Friday and Saturday nights. When we tried to get into the Lounge area to sit down we were basically told there was no chance, and we would have to stand at the bar only. On the Saturday night we waited for 40 mins at the bar to get served and eventually gave up and went to bed. There was no priority given to hotel residents which was very disappointing. The Club Room seems to be closed in January which means there simply isn't enough room for residents and outside guests. We all loved the ambience - loud, lively, buzzing - but it just felt a little too chaotic and badly managed. And we did wonder where hotel guests who prefer a quieter drink were meant to go?
In summary - this is a good hotel, with a great location. But you need to think about the kind of nighttime experience you are looking for - it's loud, lively and very cool in the Bar and Lounge, but that might not be what everyone is looking for.

title: Always a Great Experience!
text: Chic! Vibrant! Friendly! Comfortable! Those are just a few of the many aspects of the Soho Grand Hotel. My boyfriend and I stayed there together for a business trip and absolutely loved the fun energy and ambiance at both the hotel bar and the diner. The staff is exceptionally welcoming and friendly, always greeting you and making sure all your needs are met. Particularly, I was assisted by Kiara to coordinate an anniversary surprise in our room for my boyfriend. I was blown away by her desire to help me and go out of her way to make it perfect! Aside from the incredibly kind hotel staff, this hotel is modern chic with an amazing shower. It is central to New York hot spots while also being a great place to work if you're on a business trip. A perfect blend of sophistication and fun. Will most definitely return again and again. Thank you all for your wonderful hospitality.

title: Great location, will be better after Covid
text: This is a really nice hotel and so close to some great restaurants and shops, plus super convenient to the subway just around the corner. Nice wine shop across the street. We had great views too. The lobby bar is excellent though sometimes served with a bit of attitude. Highly recommend the charcuterie plate with local cheeses, honey, and salamis. The room was small for an upgrade, but it is NYC so I don't expect "big" - nice desk, comfy bed. Housekeeping was excellent, really nice people. Due to Covid, the hotel's restaurant hours are not daily and there is no concierge or bell person to assist, so you're on your own there. Gilligan's restaurant on the ground floor was really wonderful but a bit intimidating having a set amount of time to order and eat. They didn't adhere to it, and we did have a hefty bill going. This happened in another restaurant as well. 90 minutes for a party of 3. Overall, I'd stay there again if the price was right. We used Amex and got $100 toward the bill.

title: Amazing place to stay in SoHo
text:
The moment i've arrived in this hotel, i already fall in love with the facade building and the neighborhood. Located in Soho, there were a good pub, good boutiques such as The Real Real, What Goes Around, Re-Bag, Bonpoint and many more within walking distance. If anyone wanted to do a shopping trip in SoHo, you can pick this hotel. 

I love the smooth check in process, sadly i forgot the guy who has helped me and however the lighting of the hotel was a lil bit way too dark to create the right ambience, i understand but sometimes it's kind disturbing lol. My room was impeccable, not too big and not too small, i had 2 big luggages and the room can accomodate it. Beautiful view and amazing wall tv screen. What i like the most is probable their mini bar selections very diverse and well curated. 

Bathroom was very well designed and i love their shower gel and shampoo. (I decided to give it a go after trusting their taste in the mini bar selections). Unfortunately, i asked for a toothbrush and they said they don't provide free toothbrush in which u must buy one from the mini bar. 

The breakfast was amazing, everything tastes so good. Their coffee was good too! However they need to train the staff better, my colleague told me that we can have breakfast downstair so i asked the waiter, how's the mechanism since the breakfast is ala carte and they seemed clueless. Turned out we need breakfast voucher before we order the complimentary breakfast. 

Their bar and diner was amazing too, what i like about this place is this place isn't too 'touristy' but still can make a tourist like me satisfied with every details.

title: Everything about the SoHo Grand was perfect!
text: The rooms are beautiful, bedding wonderful and plush and views spectacular! We had a few requests and they were happily accomodated. Staff went above and beyond to make sure our stay was perfect. When I mentioned it was for my daughter's birthday a special treat was sent up to her room. The  lobby and bar area welcoming and comfortable. Special thank you to Andrew, the front desk manager who made this all happen.

title: Another great stay !
text:
The Soho Grand Hotel is my go to every time in NYC. 
I always enjoy my stay primarily because the staff is always fantastic.
Gilbert Aquado helped iron out my room reservation and booking.com glitch. 
William and Jack at the bar are always perfect gentlemen. 
Mimi the host was friendly and sweet to me. 
I enjoy the diner a lot especially the world class avocado toast with smoked salmon . I enjoyed my service from Ketsi very much. 
Byron late night host was great to speak to after a few drinks as I battled insomnia.
Jose and Anthony were great to talk to as I shared my fun times of the day before. 
I also enjoyed the health club daily and the gentleman with the Sicilian Cap did a great job disinfecting the machinery. 
I could spend 365 days a year in your great environment!

title: Where locals tell people - they actually like - to stay when they visit NYC
text:
Great energy from the minute you walk in.  2 lounges / bars with beautiful people, great drinks and no drama. 
Clean, modern rooms. Spring for terrace suite and you won’t be disappointed. 

So dog friendly you will feel bad if you don’t bring your pup. 

Perfect location for bars and restaurants of soho, west/east village. 

Friendly, helpful staff. 

The spot for all my staycations, or visiting friends and family.  

Marcus M is star manager; hardest working person in NYC hospitality industry I’ve come across living here 20+ years.  Always seems to be working, but brings only positive energy and solutions.

title: Ask for Michael! BEST SERVICE
text: My experience was outstanding due to one person in particular working the front desk, Michael. He addressed my concerns In a considerate and efficient manner and made sure my stay exceeded my expectations in every aspect. As well as made recommendations on things to do in the area. If you plan on staying here anytime soon definitely ask for him by name and you will receive the best service possible enjoying a memorable pleasant experience.

title: "Es könnte alles so schön sein, wenn da nur nicht die Gäste wären, die stören“.
text:
Wir waren nach all der guten Bewertungen mehr als enttäuscht von diesem Hotel. 
Das fing schon damit an, dass es uns nicht möglich war sich mit dem Personal beim Ein-Checken zu verständigen, da am Wochenende Livemusik in der Lobby gespielt wird, die sich direkt neben dem Empfang befindet. Weiter ging es damit das wir um eine Kreditkarte zur Sicherheit gefragt wurden. Das diese Karte mit 1000,- $ Vorreserviert wird, haben wir nur durch einen Mitteilung der Bank App erfahren.  Unsere Information an das Personal, das unsere Koffer leider nicht mitgekommen sind und von der Airline ins Hotel nachgeliefert werden und wir daher gerne Tipps für den Einkauf von Unterwäsche und T-Shirt wurde geflissentlich ignoriert. Könnte auch sein, dass aufgrund der lauten Musik unsere Frage nicht gehört wurde. Nebenbei wurde uns noch nonchalant mitgeteilt, dass unsere  Reservierung für den Abend zum Essen wegen einer Privatveranstaltung nicht möglich sei, aber wir könnten ja für morgen reservieren. Wir hatten aber jetzt Hunger nach einem stundenlagen Flug nach New York. 
Nachdem wir über die Koffer Tracking-App informiert wurden, dass unsere Koffer im Hotel abgegeben wurden, gingen wir an den Hotelempfang, um sie dort abzuholen. Dort wurde uns mitgeteilt die Koffer seien nicht da und es gäbe auch kleine Mitteilung in der EDV dazu. Auf unsere Bitte beim Doorman telefonisch nachzufragen, wurde uns geantwortet, wenn die Koffer nicht im System sind, sie auch nicht da seien. Wir gingen dann selbst in das EG und konnten dort im Lager unsere Koffer entdecken und mitnehmen. Einen Kofferservice der behilflich ist das Gepäck auf das Zimmer zu bringen gibt es in diesem Hotel nicht. Der Roomservice kam nur wenn wir das Schild zum Reinigen des Zimmers an die Türklinke anbrachten,  Haken für die Wintermäntel gab es keine im Zimmer und der Schrank war so klein, dass in diesen keinesfalls Kleidung für zwei Personen unterzubringen waren. Unsere Bitte nach mehr als drei Kleiderbügel kam man dann nach dreimaliger Aufforderung auch nach.
Im Hotel-Restaurant haben wir uns das Club- Sandwich mit Hähnchen bestellt, dass so scharf war das es nicht zu essen war. Unseren Hinweis an den Keller dies vielleicht auf der Karte zukünftig auch zu vermerken, wurde mit Empörung entgegen genommen. 
Der sehr unfreundliche Service wurde noch einmal getoppt an unserem letzten Tag. Unser Flug ging erst um 22.30 Uhr und wir wollten daher vom späten Nachmittag bis 18.30 Uhr in der Lobby auf unsere Abholung warten. Nach dem uns aber aufgrund von zahlreichen Reservierungen nur einen Platz von einer Stunde angeboten wurde, platze mir der Kragen. Ich dachte immer eine Hotellobby gehört in erster Linie den Hotelgästen. Das scheint in diesem Hotel nicht der Fall zu sein.
Überhaupt hatte man immer den Eindruck das der Coolness-Faktor wichtiger war als das Wohl der Hotelgäste. Einmal freundlich willkommen zu werden oder ein Lächeln beim Personal schien nicht möglich, vor allem nicht von den Mitarbeitern an der Rezeption. Ich kann mich nicht erinnern wann ich das letzte Mal im Hotel mit den Worten „next“ aufgefordert wurde mein Anliegen zu äußern.  Normalerweise werde ich höfflich gefragt, wie man mir weiter helfen kann.
Was gibt es Positives zu berichten? Die Lage des Hotels ist super, dies gilt allerdings auch für viele weitere Hotels in New York. Das dazugehörige Soho Dinner hat uns gut gefallen, nettes Personal, großartige Atmosphäre und leckere Burger.
Alles in allem lässt sich zu diesem Hotel folgender Spruch sagen „es könnte alles so schön sein, wenn da nur nicht die  Sicherlich werden wir bei unseren nächsten New York Urlaub nicht wieder in diesem Hotel absteigen.

title: Beautiful Place, Cool Vibe, Amazing Staff
text: Have been coming to SG for years... first time back since the pandemic and so pleased to find that it's better than ever. The place continues to look beautiful,  attract a nice crowd and keep it's whole "cool/sumptuous vibe". The beauty is that you get all that AND really wonderful staff. Everyone there from door to floor, front desk to bar, administration to security was warm, responsive and accommodating... so rare for a "hot spot". (And mind you... I was there for NYE). Also for Soho, location/value can't be beat. Mini-bar goodies are pretty great too.

title: Posh but not snooty
text:
Hands down the best hotel in soho!
The staff makes it even better!
Been coming for years and plan to keep coming back.
From the minute you arrive you feel welcomed.
The staff is professional,helpful and friendly!

title: Big thanks to Edward & Michael for a wonderful experience
text: When I got there at first, there were a few things amiss. Edward and Michael went above and beyond to turn everything around. Both of them truly were exceptional. They fixed things and repeatedly followed up to make sure I was okay. Also they worked together so well, I could say one thing to one of them and be certain he informed the other one, so that eg when they worked different shifts the transition was always so smooth. Edward was very kind to help me with placing a few packages from online shopping prior to arrival into my room, and he then even asked me how the shopping had worked out and if I needed assistance returning anything. Very very thoughtful. Generally the hotel is beautifully located, next to everything, & very comfy bed and showers. But if I’m coming back, it’s certainly because of Edward’s and Michael’s hospitality. Daniel at the front door was fantastic too (greeting me by name every time even though we had only met for a brief second!); and Ricky the manager was great also. Thank you all for a beautiful stay.

title: Volvería sin duda
text: Gran hotel, ubicación espléndida, personal profesional y amable. Cualquier cuestión fue atendida con eficacia y prontitud. Habitación de tamaño bueno. Vistas a la ciudad. Baño amplio y muy bien resuelto. El único problema es el ruido que produce la música del salón que se oye en todo el hotel y que en las habitaciones de los pisos bajos es insoportable. El servicio en el bar es muy deficiente y muy caro

title: Christmas and New Years 2022 - Brrrr!
text: We are currently at the hotel - Christmas through New Years 2022. Booked king corner room - it was freezing! Air coming into room around air conditioning unit into our room on the 10th floor. Bathroom heater also does not work. Big Thanks to Lesley, engineer for soho grand, that brought a space heater to us and also helped block some of the cold air coming into our room.

title: High End Hotel
text:
We had a fantastic trip to New York, and loved the Soho Grand.

Booked a high floor room and the view, including the Empire State, took my breath away when we walked in. 

Huge comfy bed, automated black out blinds, massive TV, and a great shower. 

20mins by Subway to most things we wanted to see and do. Liked the local neighbourhood as well. Enjoyed the in-house Diner several times, and the room service ordered from the Grand Bar was excellent. 

Checked in late at night, when the party atmosphere in the adjoining bar meant shouting a little to be heard over the music, but had a decent welcome experience nonetheless, including being offered champagne. 

Would stay again!

title: Comfy beds / home away from home/quiet
text: Stayed here for a few days November and December for a work trip after not staying here since pre-pandemic. Slept well every night and felt safe. Was quiet except garbage truck sounds in early morning hours one time. Beds are comfy. Service great. Clean rooms (they have been remodeled- so feel new) consistent service. Very welcoming at front desk and at front door. Handy location. Soho Diner is fantastic- great food, service and atmosphere.

title: Sleep Deprived
text: Having stayed a week each year around Thanksgiving for 6 years pre-pandemic and after writing two rave reviews in the past, I feel sad to write this review. The staff has completely changed and the room we always had exists no more. The second year we stayed (2013), the back room manager Michael (he is no longer there) would send a personal note with two chocolates up to welcome us. He always gave us the same deluxe corner room on the 15th floor. We did get a deluxe corner room (1009) this time and its as nice as before, but the room rate has increased 22%, with less amenities. One of the things we enjoyed before was a coffee room down the hall where we can get coffee (decaf or caf), capucchino, latte, tea, etc. No more. We now have two pods, two sugars, and two creamers. Some days we get refills, some days we don't. There was no decaf option or any fancy concoction. The room was booked for two, but they had one robe and set up for one. There was no clock. Fortunately, we had our iphones for alarms.  We had to run the hot water faucet for at least 3 minutes to get the hot water up to our floor. In California, where we live, we would be fined for wasting water! We always had a connecting door, but our neighbors were always considerate and quiet. Not this time, as the woman next door had a pajama party beginning at 1 a.m. the first night. After security was called, she continued, and I was tired of complaining, so I didn't. She was so loud, as were her two girl friends, that we heard everything they said and did. They finally went to sleep at 3.30 a.m. By then, we were too irritated to go to sleep.  I was assured by the front desk that she was checking out that day. She didn't. The next night. she came back to her room alone and spoke loudly on the phone until 1 a.m. I have read on Trip Advisor that some hotels in the area provide sound machines. I suggest Soho Grand do the same for noisy neighbors. As for the restaurant, the Grand Salon exceeded expectations. We hosted a Thanksgiving meal there in 2017 and it was a disaster. This time, we hosted a luncheon and everyone agreed that the food deserved a 5 out of 5 rating, with compliments to the waiter Alex. At least that was a bright spot for this year.

title: Bien situé
text:
Hôtel très bien situé. Chambre confortable mais pas du tout insonorisée, du 14eme étage vous entendez tous les bruits de la rue très bruyante. Pas de rideaux pour obscurcir la chambre, seul un store qui tamise la lumière. Bonne literie, cafetière nespresso dans la chambre.
Évitez le bar, avec son personnel incompétent et à la limite de la politesse pour certains serveurs. Allez prendre votre petit déjeuner ailleurs, pour le même prix voir moins cher il sera meilleur et surtout bien servi.

title: Empower the desk
text:
Front desk unable to resolve our reservation issue. Kept checking with mysterious person  behind the door. Still unable. We checked the website and found room that they insisted was unavailable so we booked on our own to resolve issue. 
Room was fine not exceptional.  Hotel is dated.

title: Extremely disappointing.
text:
Took two rooms for 5/6 nights in November.   The rooms themselves were fine.  The hotel staff are not warm and friendly, it almost feels as though they have done you a favour to allow you to pay to stay.  Strong smell of cannabis in the room.  Very poor internet connection especially in the communal areas.   They removed large sums of money form my bank account on check in ($1400) which they said was for future incidentals.  On the morning we were due to check out they took further sums of money from my bank account instead of using the $1400 they had taken on check in.  Almost two weeks after checking out I am still waiting for the return of the full sum meaning we've been overcharged hundreds of dollars.   Communication with the hotel is poor - they seem reluctant to engage to deal with the matter.  
We stayed over the weekend - they appear to prioritise their Saturday night locals over residents for a seat at the bar or the restaurant.  We were told that they couldn't't tell us if a table would take 30 minutes or three hours and we should eat in our room.  
All in all not what you expect from any hotel especially one in a country which prides itself on customer service.  Look elsewhere.

title: Boutique hotel che raccomando fortemente: Meravigliosa!!
text:
We had a very good staying at the soho grand hotel. The hotel is a very cool boutique hotel with all the amenities. The room are pretty big for NY we had a king deluxe 1422 and we had an amazi 
ng view of NY. The location is very convenient right in the heart of Soho with all restaurants and shops very close. The grand bar is very beautiful and it has music the atmosphere at night is very cool. All the employers at the Soho Grand are very kind ,professional and helpful . At the front desk and the guys at the doors are very kind and helpful.  I think the idea of the complimentary water is so good and convenient! I strongly raccomand Soho Grand Hotel which is so good and convenient and comfortable. The bed is very good and I have always problems on my back. The amenities for the bathroom are CO bigelows and they are very good :there is soap ,bath soap ,shampoo and conditioner. The sheets and towels are very soft and very good quality.This hotel is my hotel in NY. I love it!

title: Great stay in Soho!
text: I have finally found my favorite hotel in Soho! I was there fora week on business.I had a corner room, and it was spacious and chicly decorated. My room attendant, Muriel on the 11th floor, was the absolute best. She made me feel so welcome! The men who work at the front door are also fabulous. I loved having a diner attached to the hotel as well.

title: Great property- but really hit and miss
text: I have stayed at the Soho Grand many times, pre pandemic and now first time post pandemic. Great location and property but overall mixed feelings. I booked the largest room category ( Grand Corner King) and the room is very large, with good views and relatively quiet, as on top floors. I arrived at 9 and they gave me the room straight away (official check in is 4pm) which I consider top notch service. The room charge now also has an amenity fee which includes stuff that was available to guests (gym, neighborhood guide etc) that has always been available, so I guess it is just a hidden post pandemic price increase. It also includes complimentary water, which puzzled me as the room only featured overpriced designer minibar water. Upon asking I was given a 236ml/8ou bottle (this is not a joke), which made me laugh. You don’t get this in the room but you need to ask at reception and if you challenge the size of the bottle they throw a few into a plastic bag for you to carry up into the room. Housekeeping is impeccable and super friendly if you happen to meet them. The biggest challenge is the staff. Some are extremely friendly and some - especially in the lounge/ bar - are so arrogant that it is ridiculous. Upon checking out the receptionist did not ask whether wanted to see the bill (I did, thankfully so, as it was incorrect) and whether my stay was pleasant. The housekeeper - who probably makes a lot less money - did ask though. The bellhops are very helpful and friendly. I generally like the Soho Grand but I feel they need to reconsider their price approach (amenity fee!) and consistency of service.

title: Outstanding Service
text: I stayed at the Soho Grand in NY back in September and the hotel is amazing but it’s the people that work there that makes it the only hotel I stay in when I visit NYC! Marcus (manager), Kevin and Andrew (front desk) helped make my experience the best!! I’ll be back because of them next month..

title: Grandish
text:
Soho Grand has a tag line that says “The hotel that made Soho Grand”.
That is a bold tagline and I have to say it is not quite true. 
The hotel is nice and the location is very much if you like to stay in lower Manhattan 😀. 
The beds are good and also the pillows. Also enjoyed the gym which is small but still good gear. 
What is not working is the service it varies from person to person. Further we had to call 3 times to get the remote changed and our laundry was 1 1/2 hour late. 
We had no noise in our room as we had a room on the 7th floor and I would recommend not to have one lower down as there is a lot of parties in the bar area - which is fun if you can close it off by go to your room. 

The concierge is nice but again the service is limited meaning nobody makes a reservation for you or even suggesting to do it. 
So all in all the hotel is only grandish

title: Excellent in every way
text: Spent a couple nights over Labor Day weekend at this beautiful  property.  The experience was wonderful from start to finish.  The staff was excellent starting with the bellmen who were so helpful with parking and directions to the front desk who gave a surprise upgrade, to the housekeeping staff who went and got ice for me when the one on our floor didn't work and finally the lovely service in the lounge.  Don't miss this gem of a place, we will be back for sure!

title: Andrew is a rockstar
text: Don't normally write reviews but had to take a second to mention how incredible Andrew and the entire Soho Grand staff is. I stayed at the hotel for a week and had a minor issue at check in and not only did they fix it right away, Andrew went above and beyond to check-in with me daily to make sure I had a great stay.  Goes without saying that the hotel is gorgeous and everything you'd expect but the staff being phenomenal is what makes this a true 5 star hotel and can't wait to stay there again soon.

title: NY Staple
text: This is our go to staycation hotel and we have all of our out of town guests stay there as well. I've been frequenting this hotel for over 20 years and it is consistently great!! Highly recommend and please have the grand margarita!

title: Great location, unique character, friendly service.
text:
After a second stay I’m happy to say I had a great experience at the Soho Grand. 

My arriving flight was canceled and the lovely front desk gentleman checked me in over the phone so that my room was ready early the next day. Help through email, phone, and in-person was fast and available when needed but unobtrusive when not. 

King rooms are a great size for NY with huge window views of Tribeca. Room service was fast and tasty, but I do miss the days of real plates and silverware with tiny bottles of ketchup. In-room Nespresso with actual demitasse cups and saucers. TV can cast directly from your device with your own screening logins and internet is fast. Most importantly, the bed is comfortable and the pillows don’t deflate. 

I used the train from EWR and the hotel is a 2-minute walk from Canal Street where multiple trains stop. When ordering late-night food delivery you can skip walking through the very nice lobby in sweatpants by going directly to the ground floor. 

Bottom line: This is a beautiful property with much more character than your standard luxury hotel in a great location. I would definitely stay here again.

title: My amazing stay
text: Place is absolutely amazing. Easy to book, easy to check in. Luxury amenities. 10/10 recommend. Don’t have one bad thing to say. Staff is top notch all around. Has an amazing lobby bar. Diner is convenient and delicious. And last but not least, the private dog park.  You’ll have no regrets.

title: Rude Arrogant Reception
text:
Really great location and has a feel like a grand hotel should have. But the staff have no idea where or what they are working towards or who they are doing it for (ie the guests).
Very disappointing - also look out for the hidden charges. Once you hand over your credit card to reception you are very much at their mercy and they don’t discuss charges I paid for my minibar purchases at the desk when I checked out in cash and still was charged on my credit card later.

They also charge illegal resort fees and then a tax on that!

Obviously this is illegal and is just a way for them to eke out more cash without disclosing it upfront.

So whatever you pay expect them to stick $50 on top a night!

title: Cool but I'll try something else next time.
text: Very cool hotel.  Stopped for a 2 night's stay before overseas travel. Room with an excellent view of lower Manhattan with the World Trade Center in the middle. Loved the vibe & the bar. Great location to walk to surrounding neighborhoods & drugstore.  Hallways are way too dark for my taste & made me wonder about what might be wrong with the walls & carpet.

title: It's changed for the worse-terrible service
text:
I've stayed at the Soho Grand several times for work over the years and always enjoyed it.  This time, my partner and I checked in for a long weekend getaway in NY on Aug. 25th. We reserved an upgraded corner room and while it's been a while since COVID that I had been there, at first everything was fine. 
     The morning after we checked in, the room felt warm.  NY was in the 90s that weekend, so somewhat understandable.  We went out for the day and when we came back the room was 80 degrees.  Although it sounded like the AC was on, there was no cold air circulating.  We called the front desk and they sent up an engineer, who tried to get the AC to work, but told us it was unfixable and they'd need to move us to another room.  He told us that he'd get in touch with the front desk and they'd arrange to move us. 
      After about an hour, we hadn't heard anything and needed to leave to catch a show and dinner.  I called down to the front desk, and explained the situation.  The response "I don't know anything about this"...ok, thanks. I re-explained the engineer said he was going to reach out.  "Well nobody told me, and i don't know anything about moving rooms." thanks again for the helpful attitude.  The tone was as if I was making this up.  I told him that we were going out for the night and when we got back, I'd expect that they'd straighten this out, and have another room for us.
     We got back to the hotel around midnight on Friday night and went up to the room.  82 degrees and no AC. Back down to the desk--and when you go to the desk on Friday night, the adjacent bar has turned into a thumping nightclub and the front desk attendants stay in the office behind the desk.  After waiting for a couple of minutes, someone finally came out.  Re-explained the situation (and you have to yell over the music for them to hear you) and was greeted with "I don't know what to tell you, we're sold out".  I had to ask to speak to a manager, who came up to the room and immediately said, "wow, it's hot in here".  No kidding.  The best they could do was give us a fan, guarantee a new room at 3PM the next day and a refund of our $40 a night amenity fee.  I explained that they could have handled the situation so much better at 5PM than they were at now almost 1AM.  They couldn't even call the Roxy to see if they had rooms available-it's their sister hotel....
     We ended up checking out immediately and walking over to 11 Howard to check in in the middle of the night  (the folks at 11 Howard were great, BTW).  We were charged for a  Friday night stay we didn't even use and were treated rudely thru out the experience.  I understand things break, but to have two service people be so unhelpful really speaks to how much this hotel doesn't live up to the Grand in the title.  Now that travel is ramping back up, it's unfortunate that this hotel is off my list for NY stays...

title: Soho Grand is Unique and Interesting
text: We were pleasantly surprised with this property. We loved the unique surroundings of the building and decor. The room was lovely, bed comfortable and bathroom perfect. The bar scene is hopping and loud but great place to people watch. Loved the area for walking a shopping and the subway stop is right around the corner. Shout out to the doorman and the front desk for friendliness and  courteousness,

title: It Feels Like Home, Only Better!
text:
When we arrived at the front door of the Soho Grand Hotel, we were greeted by the same friendly face that has welcomed us many times before. I turned to David and said, “it feels like home here.” 

We checked in and were offered a complimentary glass of bubbly. We settled into an oversized comfy sofa in the lounge/lobby and enjoyed the sights…It was fashion week. So, there was a lot of great people-watching.

We asked if it was possible to get an upgrade (I always ask), and were given a King Superior room with a beautiful view. The room and bathroom were immaculate The view was beautiful. The staff was friendly and helpful.

We can't wait to go back.

title: A Mixed Bag
text:
It’s a mixed bag. This hotel is caught in a time warp.  The design aesthetic seems to be steampunk and the common spaces and hallways are very dark and unwelcoming.  The lack of a ground floor lobby makes entering and exiting  a dismal affair, more like a subway station than the entrance to a grand hotel.   Schlepping ones own bags up to the tiny 2nd floor lobby is inconvenient and makes a poor first impression. One doesn’t feel coddled here.

The terrace suite was indeed grand.  Very spacious and the terrace itself was superb with plenty of plants, comfy seating, an awning and a table for eating.  Nicely furnished rooms (I particularly liked the coffee table whose legs were stacks of the NYTimes), very comfortable bed and good quality linens.  The bathroom was enormous, the wallpaper witty and towels fluffy.   And yet there is only one hook from which to hang a towel or a bathrobe.  Style over substance.

On a silly but telling note, the very same black and white photo of Luna Park was hung both in the bedroom and in the living room.   Surely there are more images of New York to choose from.   As far as I could tell, I received nothing from the so-called “amenity” fee.  There is an overall lack of attention to the details here. Love the location but not a great value.

title: Pros and Cons
text:
Overall this hotel is fine. Pros include the comfortable bed, good location, good air conditioning, and a surprisingly quiet room given the location and the club in the basement. 

Cons - the hotel is super dark and hard to see at night, the light switches in the room are super annoying to figure out, and the ironically the shades do not darken the room. They are light filtering only so when the sun comes up, the room gets brighter. 

It's a decent stay, and good for the area, but I probably wouldn't stay here again.

title: Summer Stay at Soho Grand Hotel
text:
Spent 4 fabulous days at Soho Grand Hotel. From the moment I entered I was  happily greeted by the bellman. The front desk clerks were warm & welcoming. Helpful at sharing what types of entertainment options the hotel had that evening on my arrival. This so delightful as if one doesn't want to go out after a day of traveling, you have entertain right @ the Hotel.
My room was very well designed, the bed was beyond comfortable. Perfect after a long day of traveling. The room was impeccably clean . Rooms are extremely quiet.
This hotel has the most friendly staff. Everyone is so very kind.

title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND
text: My husband & I stayed here last weekend and what a treat!! From the door man/security guard to the wait staff to the checkout desk all very friendly and accommodating. Our room was beautiful and comfortable. We enjoyed the esthetic of the hotel very much. We had pre dinner cocktails in the Salon, which was gorgeous and the drinks were fantastic. We returned from dinner outside of the hotel and went to the Club Room for cocktails and a live jazz band who were outstanding! We absolutely loved every minute there. The morning of checkout, which isn’t til noon, we enjoyed a boozy brunch with our family at the Soho Diner located inside the hotel. It was delicious, and our waitress was on top of every thing making sure we had what we needed. I really like the amount of security they have at the hotel. The doormen are security guards and on top of everything, your room key needs to be scanned in the elevator to get to the upper floors where the rooms are located and you can’t piggyback off another guests card, each person has to scan to get to their floor. We had a few hours before our train home so we spent that time back in the Salon and enjoyed the beautiful room and conversation with our adult kids before heading out. I was such a pleasurable experience. We usually stay at another hotel as I’m very picky about cleanliness, service & security, well, this is our new go to hotel, it was better than we could have imagined, we absolutely enjoyed our time. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND giving it a try!!!!

title: Nice pleasant stay
text: Really enjoyed staying here, the room was very small but you expect that for the price in NYC. Location was great, right in the heart of Soho. Gym was well equipped as well. Only downside is not being able to walk into the bar at night as a paying guest of the hotel.

title: Wonderful hotel and staff
text: Best doormen in the city, excellent housekeeping, great selection of bar and dining options. Excellent location and close to subway lines.  Only steps from the best shopping and dining in the city.  Been staying there for 25+ years.

title: Sadly we had a poor experience
text: I don’t think we fit the right demographic as everyone else who seems to have a good visit. Family of 4, 2 rooms for a week. Great location, you can walk everywhere, we had a room upgrade which was a lovely large room with a great view. However,  we found the staff generally to be rude and unfriendly and unhelpful . We had a few celebrations during the week and despite emailing numerous times pre visit, having Amex call them and telling them on check in we had no response. There is nowhere to sit and relax, despite the cost of staying there, if you dare to sit in the lounge you will be told in no uncertain terms to move for someone coming in for drinks.  We were refused late checkout, the only place to sit and wait for taxi was the empty windowless club room where we got bitten by fleas. The hotel gave us $300 refund. We won’t be back ,  hugely disappointed.

title: Great stay, wonderful staff, good food, perfect location.
text: Wonderful ambiance, very supportive and considerate staff. Crystal went the extra mile above and beyond  a few times, very nice room, great lighting, perfect location.  I have travelled quite a bit in North America and Europe, stayed in many different hotels, but this was one of my best experiences so far. Great value for money.  Hats off! Will definitely be back soon.

title: Dont' do it
text: Tiny rooms with low ceilings that feel like a cave, no help with luggage or door man,  but the worst part is the air conditioning sounds like coins rattling around in a tin can, non-stop, blowing filthy air with particles so big you can see them as they shoot up your nostrils. Had to check out the same night to get any sleep.

title: Excllent hotel and management
text: After years of travelling to New York, Soho Grand Hotel is the one and best choice, a guarantee of: comfort room, super great service from everyone since you arrive (Night Manager Mr. Steve Kyriakes went beyond normal duties and showed what hospitality is about. He was so charming was so happy. That is very rare these days post covid. He acknowledged me every time I came to the desk. The staff was excellent and well run by Mr. Steve Kyriakes and would stay here again,

title: Excellent service by staff- night manager
text: :SOHO Grand hotel - Cleanliness, staff & service, amenities, property conditions & facilities are excellent. The night Manager Steve Kriakide  showed what hospitality  is about going beyond his normal duties. I travel a lot and his service would make me stay here again ..

title: Incredible service (great stay, too)
text: This was our first family trip to Soho Grand. The perfect launch pad for Manhattan, our stay truly couldn’t have been any better. Location was perfect, DJ accompanied our delightful dinner, view was spectacular and honestly, felt like royalty with the conscientious and above-and-beyond care from guest service agent, Kevin Barona. Down to the smallest detail, he made our stay one of the most memorable we’ve ever had in NYC. Highly recommended. Ask for Kevin!

title: Feels like home
text:
I’ve been staying here for many years so it’s become like a trusty old friend.
At first it was cutting edge boutique and it still has some of those qualities.
You can’t beat the SoHo location.  Rooms and bed are comfortable despite the noisy aircon and lack of hanging.
It’s still a go to location for some of the great and the good on the club nights.
It’s very good indeed.

The check in has always been very good here.  It must be something they really focus on
On this occasion the check in was off the charts good.  Young lady called Naomi was absolutely brilliant.
Friendly, Fun and efficient!!

title: Excellent taste of New York. Fun and great service.
text: The Soho Grand was a delight. This is my third time there and each time it gets better. Beautiful surroundings, awesome friendly service and great concierge service from Helen made the stay.  The hotel is extremely clean, the communal areas beautiful and relaxing and all employees are friendly and attentive to my needs. The hotel is in an accessible area of the city, and it is easy to get to your point of interest.

title: Excellent place for tourism and business
text: After several years of travelling to New York, Soho Grand Hotel is the one and best choice, a guarantee of: comfort room, super great service from everyone since you arrive (Jose! 😍)  till you check out.  The breakfast room (that I use to fix appointments with customers) is delicious, unique in the city.  Thanks to the management and all workers for making me feel like being at home.  I will be back soon.

title: Outstanding dining experience
text:
My husband and I spent last weekend at the Soho Grand. We live in northern New Jersey and wanted to get away for a quick romantic weekend. 

We were absolutely blown away by the wonderful, joyful and creative service of your staff. 

On Friday evening, we had dinner at Gilligan’s. We were wonderfully cared for by Marissa, Jason and John. The spectacular branzino that I had for my entree was created by Chef Dan Mackenzie who came to our table to discuss the dish that he had beautifully prepared. 

On Saturday morning, we had brunch at the Grand Bar and Salon. We were waited on by Mamun Rashid who took great care of us. We could feel his concern for us. 

On Saturday evening, we had dinner in the Club Room. What an exceptional experience! Cody, Ramon, Wahid, Christian, and Remington went out of their way to make us feel comfortable, taken care of, and very special. Daniel Menendez also made sure we were cared for. And, Chef Dan MacKenzie's  meal that he made special for us is something that we will always remember. Each of the four courses he designed was a true masterpiece that looks our breath away. Chef Dan and his staff made us feel as if we had won a grand prize, or were celebrities.

It also made us very glad to hear the respect and admiration that many of your staff have for Chef Dan MacKenzie

We look forward to returning to your hotel many times and for many years in the future.

title: Andrew, Omar, Remington and all of the employees at Soho Grand go above and beyond!
text:
Andrew at the front desk started our stay with a HUGE smile and a HUGE welcome! He was so charming was so happy. That is very rare these days post covid. He acknowledged me by Mrs Sadler every time I came to the desk. Andrew also helped us with a problem and got it fixed for us in minutes. He went above and beyond for us!
The other SWEET man at the front desk with blonde hair was a pure joy every time I had to ask for another room key! ( senior moment in remembering his name)
Omar in the lounge was the incredible! He was so personable and gave amazing service to us especially on my daughters birthday! We love Omar and can’t wait to come back and visit him!

If ever you need a hotel in NYC, go straight to SoHo Grand! You won’t regret a second!
Thanks again to EVERYONE at the Soho Grand for making my daughter’s 21st birthday weekend the BEST EVER!!!

title: The Best hotel in NYC
text: The soho grand is the must entertaining hotel in the city right now. Always something going on. The music is so much fun as well. The food is amazing and the service from the FB Director Murat Erbil is second to none. He makes everything so easy and the experience so much better.

title: Amazing Experience
text: Amazing time, new clean rooms. The service is great in the hotel. Always look out for Murat Erbil, he takes service to the next level always making the guest feel like he is at home. Really recommend the hotel enough and the food is spectacular

title: Fantastic service, beautiful hotel.
text: I love staying in Soho, especially during the week when it's a little quieter. This hotel has been a mainstay classic in Manhattan and continues to uphold high standards of beauty, service and luxury. Super reliable!! love it here.

title: Great hotel even better location!
text:
Stayed here for one night and the hotel was great. Excellent customer service and the room was clean and the size was perfect for two people. They have new 65 inch TVs in the rooms and automatic blackout shades. Downstairs there are two great restaurants and a club. We could not hear any sound from the club during our stay.

I would try getting drinks from Gilligan's as it is all outdoor seating and has a great ambiance with plants all around and a cool "beachy" vibe.

Room service was quick and the food was good but for a better food option go downstairs.

A+ service and great location in Soho. If you have the chance to stay here do it.

title: Bouncer acting like policeman…frustated people
text:
Worst hotel ever guys, believe me. I won’t reserve a room in this hotel. Once we got the room…after 1.5 hrs after the check in time the first thing we saw was a huge bug on the bed. The first night we tried to go to the hotel bar and their bouncer acted like policeman…they are bouncer…maybe 18$/hour but i understand how frustated they may be with their life. Anyway we paid for two drinks and they tried ti charge us four drinks each. When we asked for informations they said it was a mistake. We needed like 45 min of discussion to let them believe us even if we had proof. 
Once again if you are planning to visit NY o enjoy a good cocktail avoid this place and their staff

title: Joe B
text:
Mamu, Jack at the bar female lounge manager , Jose Bellman all were exemplary!  The know how to deliver genuine professional service. 
I always look forward to my visits to the Soho Grand Hotel. Meals at the diner are delicious. Avocado toast and Smoked Salmon are my favorite. 
See you July 4th weekend.

title: Incredible People on your Staff.
text:
I was in New York for a work event and was incredibly impressed by some of the staff at the Soho Grand. Sekou was exceptional and made our entire team feel very welcomed from the moment we arrived to the day we left. 

We had an event in the penthouse and were not sure what to expect. The event planner, I think her name was (Emily?) didn’t give us the warmest reception but we were blown away by the event captain Frank and our bartender who’s name escapes me. They made it a truly special night.

title: 25 years Second Home
text: The staff is the best! I have been coming here for the last 25 years and it has become my second home when I am in NY. Now that the rooms have been updated, it's even more wonderful. It has this classic NY-cool design, great energy and with a Rock'n'roll feel. Thank you for always making me feel so at home and welcome.

title: 32nd Anniversary
text: We stayed here  for our 32nd wedding anniversary, we felt so well cared for and celebrated by the staff! Housekeeping was over the top, the rooms are well appointed and large by New York standards. Also this location can not be beat! We will definitely be returning to the Soho Grand!

title: Sleep well in Soho
text: The rooms have been updated which is very nice. The mattress is very comfortable and the TV quality and a good selection of channels. The lobby bar is a nice spot to relax with comfy seating. The staff are very helpful and friendly.

title: Shopping and broadway.
text: Every encounter, every experience was as expected.  Check-in to check-out was flawless.  Atmosphere was soothing and calm.  Music on weekend was lively for those interested but did not cause any disruption of sleep for those of us ready for a snooze.   Would recommend for couples, singles, or girls trips shopping.  Wedding on site during our stay but it did not “take over” the hotel like I have experienced in other resorts.  Rooms are NYC standard (small) but very adequately appointed. Closets, nespresso, and wonderful hot showers after time out on the town.  Close to many shopping favorites and great restaurants.  Will be back !

title: Excellent stay, beautiful property, amazing location with a couple of areas for improvement
text:
My first stay in this excellent hotel went very smoothly. The staff is outstanding and caters to the business traveler. Bed was comfortable, shades blocked the light, bath amenities were very high-end. Room was immaculate. Diner breakfast was pricey but very tasty. Service in the Diner was impeccable. Location near several major subway lines is a major plus. 
Three small issues: The biggest challenge was noise in the hallway. The room door blocks no noise at all. I was awoken at 5am on the first night of my stay by someone talking in a normal voice in the hallway. The person was not shouting. After that, I used noise-canceling headphones to sleep. That should not be necessary for a hotel in this price category. Sound insulation matters. 
For $12.95, premium internet should be much stronger. 20MBps was promised; I got 15-16MBps. Service at this level should be included.
Charging $5 for each coffee pod in the room feels like an overcharge. If you put a coffee maker in the room, at least a couple of coffee pods should be complimentary. The combination of upcharges for internet and coffee along with a $34.95 amenity fee (for what??!!) is pretty over the top, to be honest, for a hotel in this price category.

title: It feels like a vacation
text:

They have the best recommendations - from restaurants to running routes, and everything in between.
Always perfect and never fussy-

title: Very comfortable and Security guys are amazing
