The Security guys were very nice, Jermaine and Mike were beyond attentive and my oldest daughter asked if Mike was single...lol Highly recommend

title: Our Stay
text:
My husband and I stayed at the Soho Grand this past week and our experience was exceptional. Our room attendant Muriel I could not recommend enough. She is absolutely a doll and the politest and most considerate I have ever encountered. We will be back and I WILL request Muriel while we stay.  Even if it’s  just to say a hello to her.  Thank you for a fabulous stay. 

The Britt’s

title: Great stay
text:
I had a great mid-week stay at the Soho Grand and will absolutely stay here again. Overall it's a beautiful hotel, that is exceptionally appointed. The mini bar in the room is very well stocked, with snacks, drinks and even Tylenol and Advil. The bed is very comfortable, and the TV in the room is HUGE. I had breakfast once at the bar, it was excellent (Omelette with bacon), I only wish I ate there more. It's also in a great location, with plenty of pubs and dining options nearby. 

Only two inconveniences I can think of; the wifi in my room wasn't great, it seemed to keep booting me off - but the staff were quick to offer me a better connection. The hot water takes a few minutes to warm up in the shower.

title: Mejor ubicación imposible. Si te gusta la zona de soho este es EL hotel.

text:
This is my 2nd stay at the Soho Grand, and it's a beautiful hotel, but I'm not sure I'll stay there again. The rooms are fabulous, clean, specious, shower is great although hot water takes a while. location is everything! 

The one thing the was missing is that spoiled hotel feeling, the feeling that you are being taken care of, an extra touch: The reception is on the 2nd floor so no one to open the doors or help with the bags, the reception area is super packed and loud because of the bar nearby so had to shuffle my way in with 2 suitcases. When I called in the middle of the night because the room next to me was having a party it took 3 times to call since the front dest couldn't hear me over the loud music, and didn't feel super safe as a woman traveling alone to have no reception or security at the front door with a bar and club in the hotel and everyone can basically walk in. 

All in all I like the hotel, decor, location but it needs that extra something

title: Good place to stay when traveling with dogs
text:
I have mixed feelings about my experience here. I got a “shades-of-yesteryear” vibe. The hotel is located at the edge of SoHo, off Canal, near Tribeca. It’s a bit gritty in this area. I used SpotHero and parked at the garage directly across the street for my two-night stay. I came in with my two dogs to visit my daughter at NYU. It’s  a 15-minute walk to Washington Square Park. It’s a quick walk to many great shops, cafes, and restaurants in SoHo, Nolita, Little Italy, and Tribeca. The very charming, hotel-owned dog park is about a 3 minute walk around the corner on Grand Street. It’s open 7-7, but, as any dog owner knows, most pups need a quick walk before bed, and there’s nowhere else close by for them to go to the bathroom. Not sure why the park can’t be accessed up until 10 or 11 pm. 

The friendly hotel doormen were only there sporadically, and there are two sets of heavy doors. With two dogs on leashes and bags, door service would have been appreciated, or at least a button to automatically activate both sets of doors. On the ground floor there’s a concierge desk. You must go up one flight to the dark lobby. Check in was quick and friendly, however there was zero recognition of my dogs, and I was on a dog package. They were out of treats for the duration of my stay.  No offer of dog beds. They provided cat-size bowls for my large dogs. No offer of pet-friendly places in the area; luckily I know the area  well. 

I was in a king-bed room on the 6th floor. The room was a decent size, and the bathroom was large by NYC standards. (For two people with luggage, it’d be a tight squeeze).  There was a good amount of storage in the armoire. Two drawers built into the window unit area were a good size. The bed was comfortable; the huge SMART tv and high-quality stereo were nice touches. I appreciated the Nespresso machine and fridge. Solid construction meant no noise from surrounding rooms; however, ask for a room not facing West Broadway, as it was very noisy all night. The room was too hot. I put on the ac and cracked the window and it was still too warm. The hot water lasted for about 30 seconds. I called the front  desk and was told to let it run to get warm. Nothing like a freezing cold shower in February. The room was very clean. I appreciated the light dimming features. Be aware there’s no blackout shade. 

It was dark everywhere in this hotel. I kept thinking I had on my sunglasses.  

I wasn’t told upon check in that I had to use my room key to operate the elevator. I flagged down an employee who tried to help me “fix” the elevator. He didn’t realize I wasn’t told about the key access and he spent about 10 minutes trying to figure out what was wrong. The three elevators were always quick and readily available. 

To me it seemed like people who don’t know NYC chose to stay here because they thought it would be hip. Maybe I’m too old to appreciate contemporary hip factor. 

I’d stay again if traveling with my dogs- the dog park was tres chic-  and for a discounted rate. If with my family, I’d stay in the many nicer-in-my-opinion properties nearby.

title: My new home where I used to call home!
text:
I met my bestie for a girls weekend and from start to finish our experience at The SoHo Grand was impeccable!!  Marcus Morales at the front desk started my trip off right. He was very informative and friendly and the complimentary champagne was such a nice touch. 

They even have a private dog park for hotel guests and their furries. It’s just around the corner on Thompson street 

The rooms are beautiful and spacious and we had an amazing view, just like last time. Jose Peña at the front door also went out of his way to help us. 

It really felt like a home away from home and not a hotel. Definitely returning next time in town!!

title: Super Hospitality, great rooms, great location!
text: Went for weekend with friends and the staff and amenities were amazing.  Guest services was amazing and teed up our stay before hand.  Marcus greeted us at check-in and was super friendly and helpful, housekeeping was amazing and the restaurant/lounge was fun, hip and food and drink was tops.  Rooms were super lovely and comfy.   Great place to hang when we weren't out enjoying NYC!  Thank you Soho Grand for an amazing weekend

title: Not perfect, but close enough
text:
Soho Grand did enough right to be 5-stars, even though a few things weren't perfect.

Starting with the good...
1. Location - everywhere is close, subway line is good, walking is good
2. Service - friendly, warm welcome, upgrade
3. Room - as far as NY goes, spacious, nicely designed, amazing view from 14th floor
4. Sleep - this is a quiet hotel, no room from surrounding rooms
5. Hotel bar - great vibes

What could be better?
1. The Diner food is pretty decent but the concept doesn't really come off and was mostly empty. They also messed up our room service order.
2. The shower drainage was slow, some maintenance around that is due
3. Getting hot water to the shower could take 5 mins (granted we were high and the weather was cold)
4. The sink drain plug mechanism was broken (had to adjust from under the bathroom sink)
5. The noise from the air con was constant, even when turned off (although it did provide some white noise air cover for the street noise)
6. Pillows too firm, kinked neck
7. Charging for decent wifi is a bit old school (basic was free)
8. No tea supplies in the room

Will we return? Probably. Like most NY hotels, pricing will range 190-500 depending on season and capacity. This hotel is probably worth something in the middle.

title: Stylish but not warm or welcoming
text: This place photographs well but leaves one feeling a bit cold.  The bar and nightclub were packed over the holidays, but rooms are surprisingly quiet and stylish with trendy masculine vibe, bed super comfy.  But the odd low lighting in the lobby and throughout the hallways,  plus the mostly unfriendly staff, give the hotel a cold, unwelcoming feeling. Bar was NYC cool, but don't expect to get into the nightclub on busy nights just because you're a hotel guest.

title: Highly recommend.
text: What an amazing weekend at the soho grand, I went in on a a Friday after work when the weather in NYC was just brutal, I thank Alanzo Stewart for such a great recommendation. I was able to wind down at night with such a great view of the city over looking the Empire State Building, The staff and the service was absolutely amazing. I recommend this place to any one looking for a cool relaxed vibe with lot’s of options to venture out in the city.

title: book it!
text: This is now my go-to place to stay when visiting NYC. The location couldn't be more ideal, within a few walking minutes you can find anything you're looking for. Not to mention the staff is very accommodating and aesthetically, it's beautiful!

title: Highly recommend.....
text:
Fantastic stay with great staff. Clean! What else could you ask for!
The Soho Grand was the perfect place to unwind and relax. we were greeted by an extremely attentive, professional and friendly staff.

title: Grand by name, Grand by nature!
text:
5th time in New York and the Soho Grand did not disappoint! 

We visited for 7 nights over New Year and choosing to stay at the Soho Grand (on recommendation from a friend) absolutely made our trip. From the moment we walked into the hotel to the time we left, we were greeted and looked after by the most friendly and obliging staff who clearly love what they do. Service was spot on and the room was luxurious with all of the trimmings.

A great location in close proximity to shopping and great dining options in Soho, Greenwich and West Village. The NYE masquerade ball was also a highlight and the hotel bars are a vibe.

I really felt like a local (what a dream) living the Grand Life at the Soho Grand. I will be back!!!

title: Top 3 Hotel in NYC - No Question About It!
text:
My girlfriend, puppy and I stayed here for a few days last month and the entire experience was incredible:

1) Top Notch Rooms and Service

2)Incredibly fun vibe w several awesome entertainment areas in the hote to socialize including casual lounges (with music at night and fun vibes), elegant bars, a private club room on Thurs, Fri and Sat nights that’s become one of the best scenes / crowds in NYC and hosts great djs, and 3 restaurants (one outdoor area with a fun bar, one diner open 24/7 and a great menu of lunch and dinner offerings in the lounge)

3) Ideal location in the heart of Soho

4) Very pet friendly and even offer guests access to a private dog park nearby that has a 2 year waitlist

5) A+ Staff, especially food, beverage and entertainment managers

I’ve stayed in dozens of NYC hotels over the years and always recommend Soho Grand to anyone considering visiting NYC. Can’t beat the combination of excellence and factors listed above

title: Highly Recommend...
text:
Part of my family and some friends decided to celebrate New Year's Eve in NYC a couple of weeks ago.  We opted to stay at the Soho Grand Hotel,  where we have stayed previously.  In spite of Covid limitations imposed by the city, the Soho Grand really delivered and enabled us to enjoy a few days of fun and relaxation. 

The rooms are very comfortable (it is NY, so space is a premium), bathrooms are great, and the bed/bedding was perfect.  We liked having a minibar in the room, and housekeeping service was prompt and discreet. Literally the only "issue" we have with the rooms is that the closet space is tiny. Not a significant deal to us, but maybe an additional dresser in the room could solve that.

The location of the SG is great, with easy walking access to numerous restaurants, great shops, and NY sights. 

We also love the lounge at the SG, and on this trip bought tickets to their NYE masquerade party.  Turned out ot be a terrific choice, and our whole party thoroughly enjoyed ringing in the new year in this setting.  A special thanks to Erbil Murat (Director of Food & Bev at the SG) for arranging all of that ! 

We will definitely stay at the SG again, and would encourage others to give it a try.

title: NYE IN NYC
text: This entire team was incredible throughout our entire stay! From the Food & Beverage team being so accommodating to our million questions about their NYE Ball which was BRILLIANT by the way! To the front of house staff everyone was incredible. Our servers in the lobby lounge were fabulous everyday and the concierge Naomi (apologies if that is misspelled) was over the top helpful, kind and truly made our stay fabulous. We adore the Soho Grand and can not wait to come back! Thank you for making our NYE week one for the books! PS book the suites, you will not be disappointed ;)

title: The best hotel experience ever!
text: My boyfriend and I have been long time fans of The Soho Grand! We have had countless date nights, staycations and  even recently attended their masquerade New Year’s party, which was a blast! The rooms are chic, food is great, service is on point and they are super dog friendly which allows us to also enjoy the hotel with our puppy, they even have an attached private dog park! If you are looking for a place to stay, get a drink or have a birthday party, this is most definitely the place!

title: Great stay at the Soho Grand
text: Had a great time here in December during the holiday season! SG is an elegant hotel with beautiful rooms and excellent service. Front desk staff was friendly and very helpful. The bar and lounge area was a delight with delicious food and cocktails. The staff here really made the experience enjoyable. We can’t wait to come back for our next trip to New York! Shout out to Steve the night manager for all his help. He was great!

title: Great hotel in a great location.
text:
Amazing boutique hotel the trendy SOHO neighborhood.  Upon arrival at 8:30 am, I wanted to drop my luggage off so I can go sightseeing & check in late in the day but the receptionist Kevin was able to check me in early & upgraded my room at no cost! Kevin was informative about the Covid situation & other questions I had with regards to the subway & neighborhood.  

The Deluxe King Room was perfect for me as a solo traveler. I had a good view of the street below & the city backdrop.  The bathroom is chic, stylish & just my style. There were no noise issues whatsoever during my stay. 

The hotel has a great bar & dining area which host music in the evenings. Perfect place for the young hip crowd along with families too.

I will definitely return on my next trip to NYC. 

Thank you, 

Brian

title: Outstanding  December stay.
text:
The hotel itself is in a great location of Soho, easy in and out. I haven't stayed in years, but the rooms must have had a recent refresh as they were much better than I remember. My room had plenty of space (for New York) which worked very efficiently, and was incredibly cared for. The bathroom and shower had generous space and was also well appointed. Dining was easy, whether off the lobby in the Grande Bar or at the Soho Diner. Excellent options at both. 

The service and staff was very caring and prompt. It was an excellent stay.

title: Old World Elegance
text: This hotel is a wonderful combination of old world elegance with updated features in the rooms.   We especially appreciated the specialized lighting in our room that could be bright or dimmed as needed, large walk-in  shower, Nespresso coffee maker with china cups and mini-bar.  We also found that every member of the Staff we encountered was helpful and personable. When asked they provided excellent recommendations on local restaurants and made us feel like we were "special guests"!

title: Style over substance.
text:
We stayed here 10 years ago. The hotel rooms are the same with the exception of the air conditioning is old and doesn’t cool the room. Toilet seat will not stay up but that could be just this room.

Upon check in we were told we needed vouchers for the breakfast which was included in our rate. We were given vouchers for 1 day and told the remaining days would be sent up to the room (they never arrived).

We dined in the hotel restaurant the first evening and service was very poor. Very slow and uninterested. 

Breakfast was exactly the same service as the prior evening. Slow, uninterested and bordering rude. 

The elevators are old and again slow. One was also out of service. 

Overall a poor stay. Mainly down to the lack of service and care to guests. It’s a shame as was once a nice property. Avoid, there are far better places worth your money.

title: Great Stay
text: Just had a great stay at the Soho Grand. The staff at the front desk Marcus & Naomi were so welcoming and super helpful as well as all the staff at the SG. Great location for strolling through Soho excellent bar and small but well appointed rooms.

title: Amazing Experience
text: Soho Grand - what a fantastic venue. The management and staff made sure we had everything we needed and the food and beverage service in particular was great. I've been staying there for 5+ years - whether for personal or business, it always is fantastic. Murat in particular is the best I know and I will always come back and refer folks there. Highly recommend!

title: Warm, genuine care, service and class
text:
An oasis. A calm and beautiful place to step away, breathe, savor a cup of tea, meet an old friend or think through one of life’s many challenges. I am restored when I stay here. 

These moments would not be possible without a caring and kind team. From the valet to the bartender, housekeeper, concierge and more, each interaction is warm, skilled and genuine - leaving the realization that this a team whole heartedly commits to doing an incredible job every single day. In any industry, this level of care and capability is rare. 

Many thanks to Jose, Martin, Mamoun, and to the incredible General Manager, Murat. While you sometimes may not know it, please know that your effort is noticed.  You make this hotel consistently special, beautiful and restorative even in the face of incredible change. 

Thank you for making my moments in your space so very special. 

Xx,

EHope 
P.s. See you again soon <3

title: Love Love LOVE SOHO GRAND.
text:
I starting staying at soho grand years ago because they’re extremely pet friendly and I felt so comfortable bringing my Frenchie. But I quickly found out that the excellent Bar & lounge service made it a two for one for me. As soon as you walk in it’s a vibe. The staff makes you feel at home immediately. The food is delicious and the Grand Margarita is hands down the best margarita in NYC. You will be LIT! I’d recommend SoHo Grand to anyone for boarding and just for a fun night out in the city!  Catch me at the bar 😜

P.S.  the DJ keeps the party going!!

title: Love this place
text: Stay here every chance I get ! Even though my work is midtown east I still stay in soho and commute. Everything feels new and not old. Kind of a soho house vibe in the room  subway tile in the bathroom . Highly recommend

title: Great Atmosphere, Even Better Food & Beverage Staff
text: As a new resident to New York, I have had difficulty finding a spot where I enjoy the atmosphere, as well as feel most comfortable and well treated. However, this wasn’t until I was welcomed at the Soho Grand and treated so well by Murat. Today, I have become a regular at the hotel and can always depend on Murat, William as well as the rest of the food and beverage staff to treat me with such exceptional service. I highly recommend that locals as well as travellers visit the Soho Grand for their standout food and beverage services.

title: Comfortable & Chic
text: Soho Grand is one of the most hospitable and welcoming hotels in all of New York. As a native New Yorker, SGH has been a staple of mine for years, and is my hotel of choice for any friends visiting or staycations that I have. While the hotel rooms are sizable and clean, the real gem of this hotel is the Grand Bar & Lounge. The staff are always welcoming and accommodating, the food + drinks are fantastic without fail, and the atmosphere on any given night is one of the chicest in the city. Management here clearly knows how to deliver elevated experiences to their guests. I haven’t had a single regret with spending my money at Soho Grand over the years, and look forward to continued patronage.

title: Festive Fabulous Fun Boutique Hotel
text:
Staying at Soho Grand Hotel is truly one of the best experiences in New York. Soho Grand Hotel provides a wonderful atmosphere with its hip and industrial chic design. With a zen & inspirational energy for all types of travelers. Extremely warm & inviting.
Impeccable service from all staff member made my stay delightful and welcoming. My room was sparkling clean and the bed was super comfortable and room was very quiet. Many amenities prevail on sight: a delicious diner, and nightly vinyl music and a gorgeous garden like dog park.
Conveniently located proximity to shopping, museums and restaurants.

title: Good People
text:
I have been going to the SoHo Grand for over a decade; mainly because of the beautiful people that work there. The life of any business is found in the humans that run it. Murat, in F&B, and, Jose and Martin, who greet folks at the front door, always make my stay a real hip experience. I thank you brothers for the care that you bring to your work.
Respect!

title: Stylish and homey in the heart of SoHo
text: The hotel is in an unbeatable location, surrounded by culture, food, shopping, and nightlife. The staff is all very friendly and helpful without the stuffy attitude you would find in some other luxury properties. The F&B options are all top notch. Even as busy as they usually are, the service and quality is never compromised. The club room is a fun addition with late night music programming on site (The Thursday Before/After parties we went to were a great vibe). I stayed for a week with my wife and what we loved the most was the ambiance and decor. All refined and stylish, but still felt like a home away from home. 10/10 would recommend.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: I have been coming to soho grand for years - recently for thanksgiving and will be returning for Christmas . It is the only hotel I recommend to anyone coming into NYC from out of town. My sister actually once stayed for a month during a home renovation. Staff is so professional, love the atmosphere and have always had an amazing experience!

title: Best Service in NYC
text: Best service in NYC. Especially the F&B team, even with masks on you feel everyone is serving you with a smile. Food is great and again can't speak enough about the service. Can't speak highly enough about how good the experience was.

title: Amazing location, friendly staff
text: It was a great pleasure to have stayed in this hotel for three days. I have really enjoyed the laid back. This hotel and  staff are everything I had wished for. Everyone and everything was absolutely perfect and exceptional. I had a great time and never had a bad meal.Very special thanks to F&B manager who made my b-day unforgettable .No to mention, all of the staff were so accommodating.

title: Whether for business or pleasure, Soho Grand Hotel is not to be missed.
text:
As a seasoned traveler and frequent visitor of New York City, the Soho Grand Hotel is without question my destination of choice. The vibe and decor capture the "high-end" feel of the Soho District, and the staff understands the art of customer service.

For those interested in the social experience, look no further. The hotel lounge, restaurant, bar, and club-room are outstanding. In the past, I have made special trips for their events (Halloween ball was the most recent), and I am hosting my staff holiday party there next month. 

Next on my list of Soho Grand to-do's is their iconic New Year's Eve ball. 

In a nutshell, I highly recommend the Soho Grand!!

title: Worst Hotel Service NOT a 4 star hotel (3 stars at best)
text: The doorman directed us to the ramp and said if our room wasn't ready, to bring the luggage back down. He was standing next to a baggage carrier. The reception desk is on the 1st floor, he expected us to go up to  1st floor and then back down again with our luggage. Most of the issue with this hotel is the lobby associated with the hotel. The hotel doesn't have a lobby. The couches next to the reception area are part of a bar/restaurant with the worst service ever. The hostess', waitstaff, bartender were rude, takes a long time to get a drink, they spilled part of the drink and didn't apologize or clean up. They spend most of the time talking in their own language ignoring the guest. They refused to make a drink with 3 ingredient drink even though they had all the ingredients (coffee, whiskey, cream).  The manager had to force the bartender to make the drink. Never have i experienced anything like this. The hotel does not take responsibility for the actions of lobby restaurant.  Which would be fine except there is NO other area to comfortable sit and have any kind of service from the hotel. There are 2 chairs by receptions and 2 chairs at the ground floor entrance. The hotel lobby bar/restaurant appears to be foreign owned and operated and they have no idea about service and regulations in the USA. I request the hotel manager call me regarding the issues with the lobby staff, I never received a call from the manager. There were similar complaints about the bar/lobby staff 4 months ago. They have done nothing to improve the service.

title: Super friendly and helpful staff at well-located, unique hotel in heart of SoHo.
text: Great hotel in SoHo. Great value for the money. Incredibly courteous staff makes or breaks a hotel experience. Staff here is excellent.  Rooms and hotel in general are spotless clean.  One of the best locations, easy to get to/from Newark airport in <30 mins.

title: A éviter vraiment
text:
A éviter vraiment  - chambres extrêmement bruyantes mal isolées sur la rue - on entend les discussions des voisins 
Service peu aimable ils font leur job mal et sans attention ni chaleur, au bar comme à la réception 
Pas possible de boire un café avant 8h même en room service !!! Pas de bar - ils  vous répondent  d’aller acheter votre café dans la rue !!  
Impossible de dîner ou prendre un verre si vous n’avez pas réservé - leur bar est plein et ils ne savent pas prioriser les clients de l’hôtel

title: Amazing wedding in ICONIC NYC
text: My husband and I got married in a very small ceremony on the terrace of our beautiful room at the SoHo Grand Hotel -- after our ceremony and day with our family, we celebrated the night away with all of our friends at The Grand Lounge and had an amazing and once in a lifetime experience. The food and beverage team were outstanding in helping us pick out foods and even create a special evening cocktail -- our service was impeccable and there was no shortage of cocktail servers and bussers making sure our mini event was perfect! Thanks go out to the SoHo Grand F&B team and the hotel group for helping make our wedding the most memorable!

title: Loved the Soho Grand!!!!!!!!
text: Came to NYC to celebrate a friends birthday. She picked the SoHo Grand and I’m so glad she did. The hotel itself has a great vibe. It’s Luxe without being pretentious. The bar and restaurant are great. Seems like a mix of business meetings during the day and a fun crowd of all ages at night. The rooms were clean,  comfortable and nicely decorated . The location is fanatic, as there are so many great restaurants in the area. Finally the service was impeccable. Everyone was warm, welcoming, and efficient. HUGE shout out to Marcus. He checked us in and was wonderful. Marcus made a great first impression and we immediately knew we were in good hands. He gave us fantastic recommendations of places to check out in the local area and was so warm and welcoming. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great hotel but a little loud at times
text:
Overall, this hotel is great. I stay here every time I come in for work but this time was a social visit. I love this hotel, its in a great location, the staff is friendly and the rooms are clean and a good size. 

This time it was a little louder than normal, at night while sleeping traffic was louder than I remember. Also, there is not a lounge/club on the lobby level so it greats crowded at night. 

Not a huge deal though. I would stay here again.

title: Great Weekend Visit
text:
I had the pleasure of staying for a weekend.  Just found hotel on booking . Com. Masun was outstanding every morning we had great conversation and he was professional knowledgeable and friendly.  Also encountered Nyrita who was elegant and warm and a pleasure to speak with. William at the bar was a machine. Great to what him work. 
Sincerely, Joseph Buonincontri

title: Amazing in every way!
text:
We recently had our wedding weekend at the Soho Grand and everything about the experience was perfect from start to finish. Stephanie in sales patiently helped us with the rooms and Murat Erbil helped up set up our causal outdoor dinner for our 40 friends and family at Gilligan's. They were so unbelievably nice to us all and even generously sent us a bottle to celebrate our marriage (we live-streamed the ceremony from our suite and the wifi was perfect for this).

The rooms were very spacious, clean and quiet, the beds beyond comfy and the bathrooms had everything we needed and more. I wish we had time to use the enormous soaking tub.
   
At Gilligan's, the food, service and ambiance were lovely and all our friends and family were going on about everything. The spicy mezcal drinks were everyone's favorite beverage.

This is our second time staying at this hotel and it won't be the last. And as we can now recognize it as the place we got married, it will always have a special meaning for us. Thanks to everyone who made it happen!

title: Fantastic Stay!
text:
We had a fantastic stay! The location couldn't have been more ideal, and the service was top-notch. ( Shout out to Clarissa, Hellen, Mallory, and Alexis, your smiles are contagious! Thank you for helping to make our anniversary trip so memorable! 

Also, I've never seen such a stocked minibar before. They thought of everything! We're very much looking forward to coming back. :)

title: Fraud
text: The hotel after having being paid in full from Expedia refused to check in me in at 1 am because they defaulted on their credit card merchant service. Even after confirming my stay was paid in full I was turned away from the hotel night manager. The merchant service system was in default. Do not book here it's a scam and they are stealing money.

title: A New York Rarity
text: Comfortable, quiet, spacious, wonderfully located, and a good value — a combination that is basically unheard of in New York City! We booked a basic room and were stunned to find a serene, amenity-packed space with a great view of Lower Manhattan. Room service was genuinely delicious. The private dog park was one of the most delightful and unusual features I’ve ever encountered in a hotel. Excellent hotel from beginning to end. We’ll be back!

title: NOT a 4.5 star hotel.
text:
I was expecting so much more.  Just another typical hotel stay in the city; might as well save half by staying somewhere that does not pretend to be better.   The location was great and the room was nice, but from the start I was a little dismayed at the service / amenities.  We arrived in the rain and there was no valet parking.  After asking a guy in uniform on the sidewalk, we were told we had to self park in the garage across the street, which required backing up.  $82 self park that you have to walk you luggage back up the entry/exit ramp and across the street in the rain.  Ok for 2 or 3 star hotel, but not here.  Of course when leaving early in the morning, it was dumping again and there was noody up front.  We crossed the street in the downpour.  Check in was fine.  Hotel is dark in halls and elevator areas (not sure if good or bad).  The room was very nice; it had just about everything you'd expect.  Typical size for the city.  
Our comically bad service at the bar: We met friends (also guests at the hotel) at the mostly empty hotel bar for a drink and after talking and waiting 10+ minutes at a table next to bar, decided to ask the tender directly what draft beer there was, so we could get a drink, like most people like to do in a bar.  All the taps are not working.  According to the bartender, they had one pale ale and one pilsner in bottles.  I asked him for 2 pilsners and one pale ale.  He heard me, as did the two other guys in uniform nearby standing around doing nothing.  He directed me to them and told me they'd take my order at the table.  Dude then came over and asked what we would like as if he had never seen us before.  I even had to repeat the order with my buddy clarifying that it was 2 pilsners and not 2 pale ales. Then, and this is the funniest part, he calls out to the bartender "two pilsners and one pale ale".  I thought I was in a sketch comedy.  The pilsners were $14 each and the pale ale was $10.  A 3 star hotel at best.  Not worth the extra $ to stay here.   Not even close.

title: Best location in Soho, kindest staff!!!!
text: I stayed at this hotel for one week in July and it was amazing!! You will find yourself right in soho - walking distance to all the best spots downtown. The hotel itself is beautiful and clean - with so many things to do from their grand bar on the second floor, to gilligans bar outside and soho diner! I didn’t want to leave when my week ended and will be there again next month!

title: Great hotel, great location
text: I just spent four nights there with my husband and two teenage daughters.  We had a double king suite. It was perfect.  Usually NYC hotel rooms appear larger online than they do in person - this was just the opposite. Nicely appointed rooms, great view, clean, spacious.  The location of the hotel is perfect for walking to so many spots - we easily walked to Tribeca, the West Village, the Highline, WTC, and other areas from here.  One of the staff that I do want to highlight is Marcus at the front desk.  He was incredibly helpful, professional and friendly.  To the management - he's a gem and someone you should help advance through your organization. He knows what hospitality means!

title: Fantastic terrace room
text: Decided to splurge a bit for our post-pandemic trip to NYC and book a terrace room for the weekend and that was the most excellent decision ever. Have stayed at this property many times over the years for work and for fun, I have never been disappointed. The terrace room we were in had a very large very beautiful terrace facing West and we happened to have two days of perfect weather. The bedroom portion is large with a large washroom. And the living room area includes a super comfy couch and chair, as well as small round table and two chairs, so you can enjoy room service. The outdoor patio had comfortable seating, beautiful lighting and greenery, a canopy which made it all-day friendly and lots of space. Service at the hotel was lovely - as always. Great stay!

title: Fantastic, relaxing stay
text: What a great experience overall. We will definitely return to the Soho Grand on our next visits. The hotel is very clean, very comfortable and a quiet oasis to come back to on a hot summer night. Great location right off the Canal St. ACE station. Comfortable lounge, easy check in and nice gym & restaurant if needed. Try to request a higher floor if staying over the weekend. If you are considering similar hotels like The Standard or The Roxy, the Soho Grand should be the choice! Big shoutout to Sekou and the front desk staff for being so welcoming.

title: Hype & Cosmopolitanism in the Big Apple!
text:
We really enjoyed the hotel, its location, the service and the welcoming!
The hotel vibes during the weekend is one of a kind, the lounge and bar are hype place to hang-out, have diner, or gather with friends for drinks, and good music and DJ sets.
The different dine-in options at the property makes it very versatile and cosmopolitan.
We would highly recommend this property for a business or leisure stay in the City!

title: Incredible Hotel, Staff is World-Class!
text: Home away from home in Soho! I've stayed here many times over the years, but my most recent stay after COVID restrictions were lifted in NYC was especially great. The rooms have been nicely renovated, tastefully designed with comfortable bedding and great bathrooms. The staff is polite, professional and personable -- shoutout to Sekou and Marcus -- they're absolute rockstars! If you're looking for a real New York experience nestled perfectly away from the more touristy, commercialized zones of the city I highly recommend the Soho Grand.

title: Well-run hotel
text: This was our 2nd visit, and we decided we liked it better than pricier Soho60. Something was (not noticeably) wrong with our room upon arrival. It was fixed immediately along with a personal note from gm’s office, a woman named Mallory Matoush. We were impressed. We also enjoyed dinner in the cozy lounge. I really like this place.

title: My NYC home since I moved out of NY
text:
The Soho Grand is simply the best hotel in NYC if you are looking for an authentic NYC experience. You will feel like you are living your best NYC life. The hotel feels like a luxury apartment and the staff makes you feel right at home. And they throw a party for you every weekend with great DJs and vibes. 

I lived in NYC for 8 years and the only place I stay now when I visit is the Soho Grand.

title: Modern but…
text:
The location of the hotel is exactly where we wanted to be. The hotel decor was modern and looks recently renovated.

The staff were all very friendly and courteous.

Ours was a room with king bed. There was a small desk, closet and mini bar. There was a shower, no tub. The room was not large, but it’s not like we’ll spend much time in the room.

So what I had not realized I’d that there was the club (?) on the lobby floor. When we arrived late Friday night, we thought we walked into a club, not a hotel when we entered. And on floor 5, we could still hear the music, which ended around 1 am.

Probably my bad for not fully researching the hotel. So I do not recommend for family, and couples looking for a quiet rest. Maybe if you stay at a higher floor? 

Hence a star off.

title: The staff made all the difference!
text: I made two trips to the Soho Grand during the past three months and was so thrilled with the staff: from check-in to housekeeping, each individual with whom I interacted was gracious, accommodating, and genuinely interested in providing me with the home away from home experience! At check-in, I received a room upgrade, and when I asked for extra towels, pillows, and water, someone came up to my room and delivered it all immediately and with a smile. My room was kept spotless, and items, such as extra towels and toiletries were replenished without me having to ask. My bed was comfy and I was able to open my windows for fresh air, which is important for me in a hotel room!
